Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Account was opened XX/XX/XXXX. At the time my credit was checked and I was approved for the department store card. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, upon closer examination of my statement, I noticed my credit line had decreased. I had received no notification of any issue. My account is in excellent standing. I phoned the provider and they stated they had no idea why my credit line had decreased and they reinstated my original credit line. 

Yesterday, while looking at my account, I noticed, yet again that my credit line had decreased. Again, no notice, no call ; no idea why. Account had a XXXX balance and excellent standing. 

I phoned the account holder today after not getting an explanation from an email the yesterday. According to the " Account Manager '' that I spoke with - XXXX has the right to periodically check my credit score from all three reporting agencies ( XXXX ; XXXX and XXXX ) and apparently are also getting credit updates on a regular basis from all three credit reporting bureaus when ever something changes on my credit report!! I never gave any permission for any company to constantly monitor my credit..and I know this is not legal. She stated that they had sent a letter on the XX/XX/XXXX. I have received nothing. She also stated they mailed letters back in XXXX ( however when I checked in XXXX the Customer Service Rep I spoke with at the time told me she didn't see any letters going out ) when I brought up this had happened before, and I had never received any letter. I asked that the letter be e-mailed to me along with any documents that they state " allow '' them to monitor and get updates on my credit. She stated that she can not e-mail them and that she needs to mail them. She would not give me any reason why this has occured. 

I never gave XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) permission to " monitor '' my credit reports from the three major credit reporting agencies. 

I have paid off the card in question and have closed the account. I have asked that my banking information be deleted from their system and I have also requested confirmation, which I have not received. 

This is a muli-issue complaint.
Company public response: None

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Problem with personal statement of dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
This past Fall I refinanced my VA Mortgage that has been held with XXXXXXXX XXXX. I reached out to XXXX in XXXX to inquire about VA IRRL options but settled on XXXX due to more competitive rates. I began receiving calls multiple times a week from XXXX in XXXX to try and get me to refinance with them as well. As those calls and voicemails continued through XXXX and XXXX I received two voicemails that my account was passed due. I contacted XXXX and was directed to the refinance team, who again was trying to sell me on a XXXX refinance and told me my loan was in good standing. I continued my refinance with XXXX XXXX and was scheduled to close in XXXX, but was delayed three times all the way to XX/XX/2020, due to XXXX XXXX being behind on closings. I continued to pay my current XXXXXXXX XXXX in the process to ensure no payments were missed in the transition. 

I was notified again by voicemail in early XXXX that I had a past due XXXX  bill, which surprised me as I had seen my check to XXXX  for the month clear. I called them back on XX/XX/XXXX and was told that I had {$64.00} past due balance on my over $ XXXX  monthly mortgage payment, based on a change to my escrow amount that I was previously unaware of. I sent payment that day which was received and cleared on XX/XX/XXXX. I inquired as to why my escrow payment was increased when I would be getting a check to close that account within a month. They wanted me to send them {$64.00} when they were going to turn around and send me a check for over {$2000.00} within a couple weeks since that account was in the process of being closed and no more payments would be made from it. I was told by the XXXX agent on the XXXX that this would not be reported to the credit agency. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I saw that my credit report showed a late payment to XXXX. I called and spoke with XXXX XXXX who said that the escrow was recalculated in XXXX and a notification was sent. He said he could see that notifications were sent again in XXXX but noted that he could see that they were returned. I believe those notices, just like my escrow refund check which was sent to me by XXXX in XXXX, was sent to the wrong address. 

I was in the midst of refinancing and XXXX had already sent out my payoff notification to XXXX XXXX and were actively trying to get me to refinance with them instead. The XXXX sales team and account management teams failed to share information and provided me incorrect information as a customer. They admitted to sending information about changes to my account to the wrong address. They should have halted any changes to the account once it was in progress of being sold. They reported a late payment to the credit reporting agencies, after saying they would not due so due to the confusion and are inaccurately reporting a late payment. My payment was never late, it was short by 1 %, {$32.00} on an over {$3200.00} payment and even then, the principal and interest were more than covered and my escrow balance had more than enough balance to cover all payments through the remainder of the loan. So much so, that I received over {$2000.00} back from XXXX to close that escrow account in less than a month.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX I put a credit freeze on all three credit reporting agencies. About a year ago, when attempting to unfreeze my Transunion credit temporarily, it had a status of 'UNKNOWN ' listed online. This status has remained each time I logged in over the past year so I finally called on XX/XX/XXXX to find out what was going on. It turns out someone else was able to change the name associated with my credit to his name. As such, Transunion placed a security watch on my account and left it as 'UNKNOWN ' ever since. Several things are wrong here : 1. The controls Transunion has in place failed and someone was able to change my name to his. Shouldn't there be a hard stop in the system to prevent this without manual updates from a Transunion rep using support documents to allow this change? 
2. I was NEVER notified of this fraud occurrence. This is another control failure. Shouldn't the impacted consumer be notified? 
3. When I spoke to the agent last week, I was informed that XXXX XXXX : XXXX was opened and a representative would call within 24 hours and that should have been on Monday XX/XX/XXXX. That call never came. Instead, 4 business days later, I received an email to call Transunion. I attempted to call THREE times and each time a text came through to ask a question and the call would disconnect. 
4. I was told during my call on XX/XX/XXXX the 'UNKNOWN ' status would be rectified. I just checked this morning and it still remains.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Since the start of this mortgage, Loan Depot has not processed my payments. Automatic withdrawals were made and reversed each time. I have called them every week at least twice a week being on calls lasting an hour or more each time. They have made copious notes on the account but can not tell me why this keeps happening. I clearly stated if my credit was affected I would be taking action. I was assured credit would not be affected however as of this filing, my credit rating dropped XXXX points in one reporting! Each time they have not been able to identify the issue in processing my payments. When asked the reply has been " we don't know ''. 

XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( automatic withdrawal ) XX/XX/XXXX Returned Payment Reversal - {$1500.00} ( company had account number incorrect ; said fixed it ) XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( automatic withdrawal ) XX/XX/XXXX Returned Payment Reversal - {$1500.00} ( company had account number incorrect again ; said fixed it again but not sure why reverted to incorrect number ) XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( automatic withdrawal ) XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( automatic withdrawal ) XX/XX/XXXX Returned Payment Reversal - {$1500.00} ( confirmed account numbers were correct ; don't know why payment not processing ) XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( phoned in payment ) XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( phoned in payment ) Multiple phone calls from XXXX. Was assured multiple times a request for a supervisor to call was put in but never heard from anyone. Only received automated calls saying payment needed to be made. Spoke to multiple representatives detailing issue and notes supposedly made on account. At one time I was transferred to 'someone who could help '. After providing all my personal info including social security number and other identifying information, individual on the other line told me could not find my account. After an hour with this person, was told they don't service my loan and no idea how I was transferred to them ... this after taking all my identifying information!! I called Loan Depot back to relate what happened and was told 'sorry - don't know how that happened '. That was it - no attempt to fix it or find out who it was I was transferred to in order to be sure information was safe. Have been sent round and round being transferred back and forth to customer service. 
This company continues to have problems processing payment. I removed automatic payment in order to make payment over the phone so account would not be affected. They provided credit reporting bureaus with information that I have not paid but have and continue to do so but they do not process. I was declined a credit card ( rating had been in the 700s ) because rating dropped to low 600s ( XXXX points! ) due to their incorrect reporting and inability to rectify issues on their end. 

From the time I applied for the mortgage they were incompetent. The closing took 4 months ( XXXX ) because they kept providing the closer with wrong paperwork. It took four attempts to close the mortgage before it was done correctly. 

I have never seen such an incompetent company in all my years.

Subject : Response to Experian 's Failure to Address Inaccurate Information and Request for Removal of Disputed Accounts Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to formally dispute and request the immediate removal of inaccurate information from my credit report, as provided for under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. Sec. 1681 ( a ) ). Upon reviewing a copy of my credit report, I have identified discrepancies and concerns regarding the accuracy of information related to the accounts referenced below I recently submitted a dispute letter to Experian, including all the necessary documentation to verify my identity and support my claim. However, I received an email response from Experian stating that they can not complete the investigation due to the alleged absence of copies of my Social Security Number ( SSN ) and identification. 

I would like to clarify that I did, in fact, include all the required documentation with my initial dispute letter. Enclosed with my certified letter to Experian were copies of my driver 's license, Social Security card, and lease agreement, all of which serve as valid proof of my identity and address. I have attached the proof of delivery for your reference. 

It is disheartening to encounter such oversight and disregard for the accuracy and thorough review of the documentation provided. These errors and inaccurate reporting on my credit report have significant consequences on my daily life, hindering my ability to secure loans, obtain housing, and even acquire necessary means of transportation. 

Furthermore, I request the immediate deletion of the unverified and closed accounts listed below : 1. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( {$810.00} ) 2. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( {$0.00} ) 3. XXXX, XXXX. XXXX ( {$0.00} ) 4. XXXX XXXX XXXX ( {$820.00} ) 5. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX ( {$0.00} ) 6. XXXX XXXX ( {$0.00} ) 7. XXXX XXXX ( {$620.00} ) 8. XXXX ( {$0.00} ) 9. XXXX ( {$0.00} ) 10. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( {$1000.00} ) I kindly request your intervention in this matter to ensure that Experian conducts a thorough investigation, rectifies their oversight, and takes immediate action to update and correct the inaccurate information on my credit report. These actions are necessary to restore the integrity and accuracy of my credit profile and protect my consumer rights. Also they mentioned the inquiry may take 45 days?? Isnt the max 30 days? How is this okay? 

I appreciate your attention to this matter and ask that you keep me informed of any actions taken in response to my complaint. Thank you for your assistance in resolving this issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Section 4021 of the Cares Act amends Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) of the FCRA ( 15 USC 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ). Now, a furnisher of data to the consumer reporting agencies that allows its customers to defer payments, make partial payments, modify credit terms, or makes other arrangements for its customers affected by XXXXOVID-19, should not report the account as delinquent, but should continue reporting it as current, unless the account was delinquent before the COVID-19 related deferral or modification, and has not been subsequently brought current. These new reporting requirements are retroactive to XXXX XXXX, 2020 and do not apply to charged-off accounts. Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was contacted earlier this year by a person claiming to represent XXXX stating that I had a past due balance on my account. At that time, I was unaware of any balance due, and had already turned in this leased vehicle to the dealership months earlier, in favor of a renewed lease on a newer vehicle. While speaking to the agent on the phone, I logged into my account at XXXX, and saw that I have a {$0.00} balance. My most recent statement for this account was dated XX/XX/2019 and showed Total Amount Due {$0.00}. 
Considering I had an unknown person calling me unsolicited and asking for money, while giving me conflicting information from what my online statement showed me, obviously this raised red flags. The agent was unable to tell me why my online account showed no balance due, or what the amount owed was for. The agent advised they would mail me an invoice showing me the balance due, which I agreed to review and pay if it was in fact legitimate. 
This invoice never arrived. I have still yet to receive any piece of paper showing what the balance owed is for. 
Moving forward, I have been in the process of refinancing my home. Earlier this month, my mortgage broker advised me that they noticed a sharp drop in my credit score from one day to the next. I immediately reviewed my credit report to find that XXXX reported my account as seriously delinquent, for a vehicle I had turned in more than six months ago, and for an account to which I have no statement showing I owe any money. To add to this, my account was enrolled in autopay, which served to pay any balance for the duration of my lease. Any money owed should have just been debited from my account, but that is not what happened. 
I have since attempted to resolve this matter with XXXX XXXX XXXX over the phone over multiple occasions. I was transferred, hung up on, and lied to. I was told I would receive a call back from a manager within 72 hours, only to find out a week later that no managers make outbound calls, and that there was no record of that request on my account. 
I have since paid the balance due, despite still not seeing any invoice to indicate what it was for, as my concern for the $ 300+ dollars that I was told I owed is far less than the impact this has taken on my credit report. I have worked very diligently throughout my life to maintain a flawless credit score, however this incident has taken me from over 800, to in the 600s at the time of this writing. I am in the process of trying to refinance my home, and this incident is severely impacting my ability to do so, and in turn costing me FAR more money than the {$300.00} XXXX requested ( and in turn received ) from me. 
I have now sent a letter in writing to XXXX, as I was told this is the only method I am able to communicate with their disputes department. I initiated a dispute with Transunion when this first appeared ealier this month, however just today this has now appeared on my XXXX   report as well, despite having already been paid! 

I have attached the most recent statement I have for this account.

Consumer complaint narrative: In XX/XX/2023 my identity was stolen. I placed a credit freeze on all of my accounts and asked for a fraud alert to be placed. I am not sure if the fraud alert was placed because this week I was told that there was no fraud alert. After I alerted experian that my identity had been stolen and asked for a fraud alert and a credit freeze, they allowed the criminal to open a membership account in my name but with their phone number and address. The criminal was able to unfreeze my credit. I have made numerous phone calls and sent countless emails about this situation. It took hours of my time to get them to close the membership account that was never mine but had access to my information.Since then my credit has been unfrozen several times. I recently found out that that fraudulent membership account was reopened and it was not by me. The criminal was able to change my mailing address in the DMV system and was mailed my new drivers license. They are aggressively trying to buy cars in my name in XXXX XXXXI have spent hours on the phone this week trying to fight this. If my credit was locked as it should be then I wouldn't have this problem. I haven't been able to reach a person at Experian this week. They sent me an email with a case # saying their is a fraud investigation and that they tried to call me. They didn't try to call me because their is no message or missed call on my phone. I have called the number from their email multiple times and left message that my credit needs to stay frozen and they need to remove the membership account and online access. No one has returned my calls and yesterday my credit was unfrozen again. They are doing more to help the criminal than they are to help me and it makes me wonder if there are criminals working there. This has been extremely stressful and time consuming and I am having to take time away from work in order to deal with it. The criminals were almost able to make a purchase of {$130000.00} in my name at XXXX this week. They are professionals and keep trying to make purchases and get credit cards. I need my credit to be frozen and stay frozen. I also want the membership account which was never mine deleted permanently. I would never do business with experian after this experience. I have made many phone calls and sent several emails to experian explaining the situation and asking for help yet nothing changes.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received notification on XX/XX/22 from XXXX XXXX regarding a new Hard Inquiry on my XXXX Credit Report from CB Indigo. Knowing that I had not recently applied for any new credit, I contacted CB Indigo on XX/XX/22 at XXXX using the information from the Inquiry section of the Credit Report. I spoke with XXXX ( XXXX ) asking if a new application was submitted in my name. She confirmed there was an application submitted after I provided her with my Name, Address & Last 4 digits of SSN. I told her that I did not apply and that this was a fraudulent application and also asked her to notate as Fraud and Cancel/Withdraw the application. I also asked that the Hard Credit Inquiry be removed due to Fraud. She transferred me XXXX ( Account Manager ). I explained what had happened again and was told that they are unable to remove the Credit Inquiry and I would need to contact the Credit Bureau. 
I then went to the XXXX website ( same day ) and spoke to XXXX ( Agent ) via Chat feature and explained everything that transpired and my conversation with XXXX and XXXX at CB Indigo. XXXX confirmed the Hard Inquiry and told me that Inquiries are not able to be disputed with Credit Bureaus and they need to be removed by the Lender. He assisted with sending a notification to the Creditor stating that I didn't recognize the Inquiry to see if they would remove it with that and told me to check back a week later ( today ) and see if the Inquiry was removed. If the Inquiry was not removed ( which it has not been ), then I would need to either file a Police Report or an FTC Report. Once either of those had been filed then I would need to send it to XXXX for them to get the legal authorization to remove the Hard Inquiry. He mentioned that was the only way they can get Hard Inquiries removed. 
When I went to the FTC website to report my Issue ( Credit Reporting ), it brought me to the XXXX XXXX. 
I am really having a hard time understanding why this is such an extensive process to remove a Hard Credit Inquiry for an application that is Fraudulent. I never gave my permission nor applied for any Credit with CB Indigo. I do also have a Fraud Alert/Consumer Narrative on all 3 Credit Bureaus , so if CB Indigo did their due diligence and contacted me using the contact info provided in Consumer Narrative section on my Credit Report, I would have confirmed Fraud at that time.
Company public response: None

Consumer complaint narrative: I have recently been trying to obtain a consolidation loan. I have repeatedly been denied and when I check the reasons for my denial, the responses include : Serious delinquency and too few accounts currently paid as agreed. These are false statements because I have an exceptional payment record according to my actual credit reports that I have sent for, as well as credit monitoring on XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX. I have repeatedly called all three credit bureaus asking why they keep giving these responses to the lenders I apply to but they have no answer to give me. I realize my credit score is not yet at 700, but it is not because of serious delinquency or too few accounts paid as agreed. These are most definitely false statements. I will agree that my proportion of balances to credit limits on bank/national revolving accounts is too high, however that is why I am applying for a consolidation loan. In addition, the credit report states that the proportion of loan balances to loan amounts is too high. This is also untrue as my XXXX loan has gone down from {$7000.00} to {$4500.00}. I am currently paying on a car loan, however the balance has taken a long time to move because I had to pay for GAP insurance coverage first before I could start paying on the principal. I feel these false statements are very unfair and unjust.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Case XXXX previously opened was not addressed. Transunion blatantly ignored my requests. Someone else at Transunion already disclosed that XXXX XXXX was able to change the report to his name at which time Transunion put a security alert on my account ( without notifying me of the breach ). So now they are dodging my questions and this issue is not resolved. Below are my questions : 1. When did XXXX XXXX access my account and make the change?

2. Why wasnt I notified?

3. Why isnt there a stop in the system to prevent this from happening?

4. To change the report to his name there should be documentation requested from him that substantiates his request. Why wasnt this obtained?

5. What assurances do I have that this will not happen in the future?

6. Now, more importantly, why did Transunion ignore my questions about the security breach. Today I received an email from Transunions escalation team. It covers up the fact that they allowed XXXX XXXX to change my report to his name and failed to notify me. It reads as follows : Hello XXXX XXXX XXXX, We have reviewed your complaint along with the information you provided regarding this issue. Due to a system issue, your credit report was previously unavailable online ; however, the issue has been resolved. 
According to our records, on XX/XX/2023, a temporary lift, with an expiration date of XX/XX/2023, of your TransUnion security freeze was applied per telephone call received. Please note that in order to manage your TransUnion security freeze online, you must create a XXXX XXXX XXXX account. Please visit Visit www.transunion.com/credit-freeze for more information. 
Currently, your name and address reflect as provided within this complaint on your TransUnion credit report. 

Please review my previous complaint. Transunion did not address my concerns.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Rhode Island XXXX Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX SS # : XXXX Dear, Equifax Re : This is not a regular dispute. Take action immediately you are in violation. 

I am a victim of identity theft and I write to dispute certain information in my file resulting from the crime that i recently became aware of. The items I am disputing do not relate to any transactions that I have made or authorized. Please REMOVE this information at the earliest possible time. 

As required by section FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) a copy of which is enclosed which states that this information must be removed within four business days of receipt, I am requesting that the adverse information on the items be removed to correct my credit report. 

Please investigate these matters and remove the disputed items as soon as possible. 

1. The inquiry was not authorized XXXX XXXX XXXX  Date of inquiry : XXXX  I do not remember authorizing this inquiry. Since it might be fraudulent I want it removed from my credit report IMMEDIATELY! 

2. XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX I am interested to know how you are always able to verify something that never actually happened? I dont remember ever being late with any of my payments. Remove this harmful incorrect data immediately from my credit file. 

3. XXXXXXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX This situation is completely absurd. There is no record in my possession that this account belongs to me. You must remove this inaccurate information from my credit report without any delay. 

4. The inquiry was not authorized XXXX XXXX Date of inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX I do not remember authorizing this inquiry. Since it might be fraudulent I want it removed from my credit report IMMEDIATELY! 

5. The inquiry was not authorized XXXX XXXX Date of inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX I do not remember authorizing this inquiry. Since it might be fraudulent I want it removed from my credit report IMMEDIATELY! 

6. The inquiry was not authorized XXXX XXXX Date of inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX I do not remember authorizing this inquiry. Since it might be fraudulent I want it removed from my credit report IMMEDIATELY! 

7. The inquiry was not authorized XXXX  Date of inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX I do not remember authorizing this inquiry. Since it might be fraudulent I want it removed from my credit report IMMEDIATELY! 

8. The inquiry was not authorized XXXX XXXX Date of inquiry : XXXX  I do not remember authorizing this inquiry. Since it might be fraudulent I want it removed from my credit report IMMEDIATELY! 




Enclosures : Proof of identity : Proof of Address, ID, FCRA 605b Enclosure Identity Theft report Please note that you have 30 days to complete this investigation, as per the Fair Credit Reporting Act Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested as well, to be provided within ( 5 ) days of the completion of your re-investigation and I am keeping a careful record of your actions, including your Method of Verification. I do not consent to e-Oscar or any means of automated verification. 

Failure to respond satisfactorily within 30 days of receipt of this certified letter may result in a small claims action against your company, seeking {$5000.00} per violation for : 1. ) Defamation 2. ) Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3. ) Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act 4. ) Financial Injury My contact information is as follows : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Rhode Island XXXX SSN : SS # : XXXX P.S. Please be aware that dependent upon your response, I may be detailing any potential issues with your company via an online public press release, including documentation of any potential small claims action. I am also including a copy of my complaint to the organizations below : CC : XXXX XXXX Assistant Director of Enforcement Consumer Financial Protection Bureau 1700 G. Street NW Washington, D.C. 2055 CC : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CC : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau CC : Attorney Generals Office CC : XXXX XXXX XXXX CC : State Senate CC : Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation CC : Comptroller Of The Currency CC : Federal Reserve System CC : Credit and insurance CC : Federal Trade Commission XXXX : State Regulatory agency CC : California Regulatory agency Division of consumer complaints Thank You, Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter is a formal complaint that you are reporting inaccurate and incomplete credit information. 

I am distressed that you have included the information below in my credit profile and that you have failed to maintain reasonable procedures in your operations to assure maximum possible accuracy in the credit reports you publish. Credit reporting laws ensure that bureaus report only 100 % accurate credit information. Every step must be taken to assure the information reported is completely accurate and correct. The following information therefore needs to be re-investigated.

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are required by federal law to verify, through the physical verification of the original signed consumer contract, any and all accounts that you post on a credit report. Otherwise anyone paying for your reporting services could fax, mail or email in a fraudulent account.

I demand to see verifiable proof ( i.e. : an original consumer contract with my signature on it ) that you have on file for the account listed below.

Your failure to positively verify these accounts has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Under the FCRA, unverifiable accounts must be removed and if you are unable to provide me a copy of verifiable proof, you must remove the account listed below.

I have repeatedly called all three credit bureaus asking why they keep giving these responses to the lenders I apply to but they have no answer to give me. I realize my credit score is not yet at 700, but it is not because of serious delinquency or too few accounts paid as agreed. These are most definitely false statements. I will agree that my proportion of balances to credit limits on bank/national revolving accounts is too high, however that is why I am applying for a consolidation loan. In addition, the credit report states that the proportion of loan balances to loan amounts is too high. This is also untrue as my XXXX loan has gone down from {$7000.00} to {$4500.00}. I am currently paying on a car loan, however the balance has taken a long time to move because I had to pay for GAP insurance coverage first before I could start paying on the principal. I feel these false statements are very unfair and unjust.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern, In XX/XX/XXXX, I was notified by Experian of a credit score increase to XXXX. My payments are exceptional and due to the pandemic, I ensured that I paid all of my credit cards off, just in case. In XXXX, I was notified by one of my credit card companies that they were raising my credit limit and switching me from a secured to an unsecured credit card with a XXXX dollar credit limit. I assumed that such a congratulatory event would cause an increase in my credit score.  Unfortunately, they dropped it to XXXX for no reason. I assume because I was not using my credit cards at the time. I sent an inquiry and they reflected an increase in the limit on my credit card, but the score remained. 
I pay my credit cards off, whenever I use them and I don't use them unless it is needed. I find it strange that consumers are penalized for not using credit frivolously with the reporting agencies attempting to goad us into " boosting '' scores by adding utility bills. I think it's a scam and it should be investigated. I'm attempting to recover my score, after filing bankruptcy in XXXX. I have been exceptional in my payments but regardless, I am remaining in a subprime lending zone, when my behavior doesn't warrant such a position. Please investigate this, as it is unfair.

This is to highlight the correspondence for the claim for a missing shipment ( non-delivery of goods ) that I had initiated with the courier ( XXXX ) for the XXXX set that I had ordered from XXXX and originally requested the loan from XXXX to pay for, with payments being scheduled in installaments. 

There is additional correspondence w/ XXXX  that can be provided upon request, along with my LiveChat transcript to confirm the non-delivery of goods with XXXX  - only the company FAQ page was provided, and the Return Policy, which XXXX claimed that this inquiry fell outside of. 

When I reached out to XXXX originally on XX/XX/2022, they had provided a window for delivery between XX/XX/XXXX which happened to fall on a Saturday ( XX/XX/2022 ). When it was confirmed to me that the package was delivered to the incorrect location on XX/XX/2022 ( they would attempt to recover the package, which failed ), I was informed that I should reach out to the vendor or shipper. However, the XXXX team for XX/XX/XXXXwas unavailable on Saturday. When I initiated the claim withXX/XX/XXXXto dispute the loan and begin the investigation to confirm delivery with XX/XX/XXXXon the following Monday, XX/XX/2022, they had failed to update the claim until the FOLLOWING Monday, XX/XX/2022. At this point, XXXX has and will only provide the Confirmation of Delivery page attached which provides a link to the XXXX XXXX tracking page. Upon additional confirmation, the provided document ( attached ) only shows Delivery to Service Area XXXX, MA without any signature provided. It has been confirmed on this XXXX tracking # XXXX & XXXX Claim Reference Number XXXX that the package has been lost/stolen in transit. However, they confirmed an inquiry into either of these provided reference numbers by the vendor or shipper would be required to further process a refund ( on the loan to XX/XX/XXXX ) by the courier due to the package being lost/stolen in transit ( indicated on the provided correspondence w/ XXXX attached ) XXXX 

This claim was never followed up on, nor was it properly investigated by XXXX or XXXX. The provider for the goods, XXXX, did not provide an adequate response to the initial investigation by XX/XX/XXXX, and after numerous follow-ups with both companies since XX/XX/2022, I have formally filed complaints against both companies with the XX/XX/XXXX and I have contacted the local Consumer Protection Bureau through the RI Attorney General 's office for additional guidance. I am currently investigating this further with assistance from XXXX XXXX, as XXXX is now reporting a delinquent payment for the existing loan on these goods to Experian on behalf of the creditor. 

I do not understand how an individual is held liable for payments on goods/services that were never rendered, and how the investigation and claim on my end hold no weight in the formal outcome for the numerous disputes I have filed over the past 6 months. 



When I was able to get in touch with a XX/XX/XXXX customer service representative the following week on XX/XX/2022 via Live Chat, they provided the FAQ links for the company and refused to provide an email for me to have been able to formally report a missing shipment within a reasonable timeframe. 

I did reach out to XXXX on XXXX, XXXX - XXXX, XX/XX/XXXXvia Live Chat the only available way to contact a representative - however, there is only an automated chat response outside of their regular business hours that does not provide an email or follow up correspondence to confirm with a live representative after the fact, so I had waited for the formal dispute with XX/XX/XXXX to upload in their system to highlight the dispute with the payment ( loan ) processor and claim with XXXX. 

To date, they hold that they are within their return policy and have only provide the Confirmation of Delivery page attached with the link to the provided XXXX documents, without acknowledging or investigating the additional response from XXXX that had been initiated via my intial call to check on the status of the shipment on XX/XX/2022.

Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom it May Concern, I have already filed a complaint. This is an additional complaint and supplementary information I have noticed. Per the attachment, there was a posted payment of {$13000.00} on XX/XX/2021 by whomever the account holder. The account balance at that time was {$4000.00} dollars. The high credit and original loan amount of whoever 's account this is was {$9000.00}. This is the posted unanimous information being reported amongst all three major credit bureaus. Can you please advise how with an original balance of {$9000.00} would have a past due balance with a posted unanimous payment of {$13000.00} amongst all three bureaus in addition to a perfect payment history? Further, XXXX and XXXX reflect late payments after the account should have been XXXX 'd out. It also appears possibly XXXX and XXXX XXXX reflect payments as well. The difference of {$4000.00} and a {$13000.00} payment is positive and should not reflect late payments to whomever the account holder is. I feel the payment history should be thoroughly reviewed. 

Companies that provide information to consumer reporting agencies also have specific legal obligations, including the duty to investigate disputed information. I have been denied this right. Anyone actually looking over the information would notice none of the numbers make any sense. Simply asking the company " oh is that correct '' is not proper due diligence nor an acceptable response. This information can be taken directly off of the credit report without even contacting any company. The account is riddled with inconsistencies and for that fact alone it needs to be removed. This request is further supplemented by the following definitions all of which are met. 

An account whose status is paid in full, and thus has no balance due but nevertheless reflects a balance due ; An account that reflects an Original Loan Amount that increases over time, an impossibility by definition ; Derogatory information being reported on an account, although that derogatory information predates an earlier report that did not include the derogatory information. 

The account is not mine and I do not owe them anything. The account is riddled with illogical reporting. My credit has always been perfect across the board never a single late payment. I notice a false account on my reports and I dispute it and then all of a sudden you want to retaliatorily change loan amounts and past due balances and throw late payments on there. I have copies of all the prior credit reports. There was never a late payment reported or derogatory information in any prior reports until I stated the balance was not mine. The changes to the report were done in malice. My information was also leaked and documentation to support that has also been submitted. I do not know what it is but what I do know is that none of it is correct. 

The bureaus have a duty to report accurate information and the misreporting of such information is misutilization of my information and a violation of the fair credit reporting act. Further, this is a misrepresentation of my character which has done me economic harm and damages and I want the account removed immediately. I would say an additional 17 months now I have been forced to be a renter due to improper credit reporting at a current market rent of {$1200.00}. ( {$21000.00} ). I have other large personal obligations that have either had to close at above market rates or were not able to close. 

Look at my perfect credit history exclusive of that account, over ~12 years of perfect payments. You are denying me the right to seek a home or other credit predicated on comical posted transactional history, illogical reporting, and retaliatory practices. I would venture to say the aforementioned may possibly constitute negligent noncompliance with the fair credit reporting act. [ Civil liability for negligent noncompliance 15 U.S.C. 1681o ] Thank you for your consideration.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This is to highlight the correspondence for the claim for a missing shipment ( non-delivery of goods ) that I had initiated with the courier ( XXXX ) for the XXXX set that I had ordered from XXXX and originally requested the loan from Affirm to pay for, with payments being scheduled in installaments. 

There is additional correspondence w/ Affirm that can be provided upon request, along with my LiveChat transcript to confirm the non-delivery of goods with XXXX - only the company FAQ page was provided, and the Return Policy, which XXXX claimed that this inquiry fell outside of. 

When I reached out to XXXX originally on XX/XX/2022, they had provided a window for delivery between XX/XX/XXXX which happened to fall on a Saturday ( XX/XX/2022 ). When it was confirmed to me that the package was delivered to the incorrect location on XX/XX/2022 ( they would attempt to recover the package, which failed ), I was informed that I should reach out to the vendor or shipper. However, the XXXX team for XX/XX/XXXXwas unavailable on Saturday. When I initiated the claim with Affirm to dispute the loan and begin the investigation to confirm delivery with XX/XX/XXXXon the following Monday, XX/XX/2022, they had failed to update the claim until the FOLLOWING Monday, XX/XX/2022. At this point, XXXX has and will only provide the Confirmation of Delivery page attached which provides a link to the XXXX XXXX tracking page. Upon additional confirmation, the provided document ( attached ) only shows Delivery to Service Area XXXX, MA without any signature provided. It has been confirmed on this XXXX tracking # XXXX & XXXX Claim Reference Number XXXX that the package has been lost/stolen in transit. However, they confirmed an inquiry into either of these provided reference numbers by the vendor or shipper would be required to further process a refund ( on the loan to Affirm ) by the courier due to the package being lost/stolen in transit ( indicated on the provided correspondence w/ XXXX attached ) XXXX 

This claim was never followed up on, nor was it properly investigated by Affirm or XXXX. The provider for the goods, XXXX, did not provide an adequate response to the initial investigation by Affirm, and after numerous follow-ups with both companies since XX/XX/2022, I have formally filed complaints against both companies with the XXXX XXXX XXXX and I have contacted the local Consumer Protection Bureau through the RI Attorney General 's office for additional guidance. I am currently investigating this further with assistance from XXXX XXXX, as Affirm is now reporting a delinquent payment for the existing loan on these goods to XXXX on behalf of the creditor. 

I do not understand how an individual is held liable for payments on goods/services that were never rendered, and how the investigation and claim on my end hold no weight in the formal outcome for the numerous disputes I have filed over the past 6 months. 



When I was able to get in touch with a XXXX customer service representative the following week on XX/XX/2022 via Live Chat, they provided the FAQ links for the company and refused to provide an email for me to have been able to formally report a missing shipment within a reasonable timeframe. 

I did reach out to XXXX on XXXX, XXXX - XXXX, XXXX via Live Chat the only available way to contact a representative - however, there is only an automated chat response outside of their regular business hours that does not provide an email or follow up correspondence to confirm with a live representative after the fact, so I had waited for the formal dispute with Affirm to upload in their system to highlight the dispute with the payment ( loan ) processor and claim with XXXX. 

To date, they hold that they are within their return policy and have only provide the Confirmation of Delivery page attached with the link to the provided XXXX documents, without acknowledging or investigating the additional response from XXXX that had been initiated via my intial call to check on the status of the shipment on XX/XX/2022.

I provided both and have attached to this complaint. A federal affidavit, FTC Report # XXXX, stating I was a victim of identity theft and a copy of a valid government identification. The Fair Credit Reporting Act, states that I have rights, 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies. A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. I know this information is inaccurate. The furnisher of this information, XXXX, is unwilling to accept the federally provided FTC # XXXX Identity Theft Report and the communication I have made stating the information is fraudulent and inaccurate. The furnisher and creditor XXXX, is also claiming payments to this account are currently being made, which is not being paid by me from whom this account is apparently tied to. XXXX and EXPERIAN will not recognize that is account is not mine, nor has it ever been. I was a victim of identity theft and this is fraudulent.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have had repeated problems with Chase bank. In XX/XX/XXXX I was notified of a hard credit inquiry done by Chase on XX/XX/XXXX and I called Chase to find out what was going on as I had not applied for any credit. They said they would mark it as fraud and send a letter to have that inquiry masked on my credit reports. 

In XXXX I was going over my credit reports and noticed that the inquiry from XXXX was still showing and that there was now a second inquiry dating from XX/XX/XXXX. I called in and was told that they would send off a letter to have both of the inquiries masked. I received a letter confirming this on XX/XX/XXXX. 

This evening I received another alert from XXXX and once again there is a new hard inquiry on my credit report from Chase. 

I called them and was passed from person to person and finally spoke with the right department who said that the application came from XXXX. They assured me that they would deny the application and that they would send a request to have this inquiry also masked from my report. 

I find it very hard to believe that if someone has my information that there would't be other fraudulent applications being made through other underwriting institutions. Chase is the ONLY one to show up which leads me to believe that there are other problems at Chase that have nothing to do with XXXX.

I would also like to add that these companies have violated my rights under the FCRA, 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 states A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate ; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate.This is a clear violation AS THE LAW SAYS. Consumer complaint narrative:
I have tried now for months to handle this on my own. I have gone to Citizens bank and they don't even want to sit down with me because the account is closed. I tried XX/XX/XXXX and again in XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. I have also called numerous times same dates because I would go into the branch they would give me number because, " they were unable to help me '' and I was on the phone for hours transferred to multiple times all while getting no where. Then one day recently XX/XX/XXXX I called to be transferred to 6 representatives when I finally got a nasty man XXXX XXXX agent number XXXX. That was a 4 hour conversation where I was transferred 6 times and they said there is nothing they can do because the account is in my name and closed. 

Back in XXXX I started working for XXXX XXXX, owner of XXXX XXXX XXXX  and XXXX XXXX XXXX, in XXXX XXXX. I was doing mostly office work helping him collect on past due accounts, I was in charge of payroll, ( Which never happened ) scheduling and sometimes I would go out into the field for estimates or to do work. He had mentioned to me that he was going to add me on the " XXXX Bank account '' and make me a signer because we were getting into situations when he would want me to write checks and I told him I can not because it is not my account. Then one day in XXXX we went into a XXXX bank and we did just that, made me a signer. I made it clear on multiple occasions I just wanted to be a signer. That day when I was added XXXX account was already negative, I said this seems like a bad idea I don't want to go on this account as a signer when it is negative. He said a customer had written him a check and it will be handled. I believed him. 

Now fast forward to XX/XX/XXXX I have never written any checks out of that account nor did I ever have a debit card with my name on it. My issue is this was his account it is negative because of his negligence not mine. I had a XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX account for 19 years which now is closed and purged because XXXX XXXX wrote and deposited checks into my account and they were bogus. I have already filed charges against him and had to get multiple police reports because this man stole my identity and ruined my life in just under a year. He is now being held at the XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX where he is facing multiple larceny, stolen identity, and forgery charges. 

I need help resolving this issue so I can begin to get my life back. When I met him I had an XXXX credit score and the same bank account for 19 years. My credit score is now under a 5 and I am unable to get a bank account because of him. He also opened a XXXX account in my name which had multiple checks deposited and it was left negative and purged. He opened that without any of my knowledge.

Consumer complaint narrative: I shall begin by saying this is a cease and desist letter to the companies XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, EQUIFAX, AND XXXX. I am seeking Monetary Relief because my rights under the FCRA have been violated by XXXX XXXX XXXX ( 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance ). This company has been reporting to all 3 credit bureaus that my account has been charged off however, they have been constantly harassing me via email to make a payment. Below I have attached proof of how the account is reporting on my credit report which is also accurate for the other bureaus and I've also attached proof of them emailing me today XX/XX/ saying that I owe a payment. I would like this account IMMEDIATELY deleted and removed from all 3 credit bureaus as this is a CLEAR violation of my rights. This corporation is trying to profit from the government as I assumed they filed a 1099C for this " debt '' and they are also trying to profit off of myself as a consumer since they are STILL asking me to make a payment. HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE and shame on them!!! I would also like to receive monetary relief from the 3 major credit bureaus as I have reported MULTIPLE times that this company has been violating my rights and all they have done was validate the account without any explanation as to HOW they validated it. I'm confused because I was under the impression that these credit bureaus have an obligation to the CONSUMER but it looks like they are working together with these major corporations to try and profit off of poor consumers as this account has cost me thousands of dollars in interest. I will take legal action if this account is not removed and deleted within 15 days off of all 3 of my credit reports as there is no excuse or explanation that can justify such violation!!!

Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened a XXXX XXXX account ( stupidly ) in XXXX. It was stupid, not proud of it. I have paid for it. 
NCA ( creditors ) have been falsely reporting it as opened in XXXX. When I call them about it, they say its a typo and tell me to just wait for it to come off When I asked the credit bureaus, specifically XXXX, to please verify it, they said its verified. I asked how- being that even the creditors themselves have admitted it is incorrect information. They say we dont have to disclose to you any verifying documents. I asked, repeatedly, how they could have possibly verified the dates being that even the creditors have admitted they are wrong. They tell me take it up with the creditors. I tell them I have. Over and over again for the past year. They ignore me. 

Im at a loss. Its illegal to report inaccurate information but nobody seems to follow the law. They hang up on me, laugh in my face, tell me to just ride it out. 
I dont want to ride it out. Its against the law. Its illegal to be reporting something as XXXX when it was a stupid mistake I made as a kid. 

XXXX has lied about verifying the information. They havent. They have no documents. 

This is illegal and needs to be removed from my credit report.
Company public response: None

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Information belongs to someone else
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom it May Concern, I have already filed a complaint. This is an additional complaint and supplementary information I have noticed. Per the attachment, there was a posted payment of {$13000.00} on XX/XX/2021 by whomever the account holder. The account balance at that time was {$4000.00} dollars. The high credit and original loan amount of whoever 's account this is was {$9000.00}. This is the posted unanimous information being reported amongst all three major credit bureaus. Can you please advise how with an original balance of {$9000.00} would have a past due balance with a posted unanimous payment of {$13000.00} amongst all three bureaus in addition to a perfect payment history? Further, XXXX and XXXX reflect late payments after the account should have been zero 'd out. It also appears possibly XXXX and XXXX XXXX reflect payments as well. The difference of {$4000.00} and a {$13000.00} payment is positive and should not reflect late payments to whomever the account holder is. I feel the payment history should be thoroughly reviewed. 

Companies that provide information to consumer reporting agencies also have specific legal obligations, including the duty to investigate disputed information. I have been denied this right. Anyone actually looking over the information would notice none of the numbers make any sense. Simply asking the company " oh is that correct '' is not proper due diligence nor an acceptable response. This information can be taken directly off of the credit report without even contacting any company. The account is riddled with inconsistencies and for that fact alone it needs to be removed. This request is further supplemented by the following definitions all of which are met. 

An account whose status is paid in full, and thus has no balance due but nevertheless reflects a balance due ; An account that reflects an Original Loan Amount that increases over time, an impossibility by definition ; Derogatory information being reported on an account, although that derogatory information predates an earlier report that did not include the derogatory information. 

The account is not mine and I do not owe them anything. The account is riddled with illogical reporting. My credit has always been perfect across the board never a single late payment. I notice a false account on my reports and I dispute it and then all of a sudden you want to retaliatorily change loan amounts and past due balances and throw late payments on there. I have copies of all the prior credit reports. There was never a late payment reported or derogatory information in any prior reports until I stated the balance was not mine. The changes to the report were done in malice. My information was also leaked and documentation to support that has also been submitted. I do not know what it is but what I do know is that none of it is correct. 

The bureaus have a duty to report accurate information and the misreporting of such information is misutilization of my information and a violation of the fair credit reporting act. Further, this is a misrepresentation of my character which has done me economic harm and damages and I want the account removed immediately. I would say an additional 17 months now I have been forced to be a renter due to improper credit reporting at a current market rent of {$1200.00}. ( {$21000.00} ). I have other large personal obligations that have either had to close at above market rates or were not able to close. 

Look at my perfect credit history exclusive of that account, over XXXX years of perfect payments. You are denying me the right to seek a home or other credit predicated on comical posted transactional history, illogical reporting, and retaliatory practices. I would venture to say the aforementioned may possibly constitute negligent noncompliance with the fair credit reporting act. [ Civil liability for negligent noncompliance 15 U.S.C. 1681o ] Thank you for your consideration.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

I called XXXX and tried to figure out how to fix my account. But was told rudely that my file was sold? 
Ultities we're opened or reopened in my name on XXXX XXXX. After I moved XX/XX/XXXX? XXXX was one they say I owe 1200+ yet I returned equipment 2 months after I moved. I had boxed equipment in basement. 
even have confirmation email from XXXX for pickup. 
I soon found out my credit card was hacked. 
Bank closed and new one opened. My XXXX account with store hacked with all finicial & personal info on sites, I filed police report, identify thief. Org report, FBI report, this hacker from same state was blackmailing me for XXXX! 
I explained all this to companies and credit reports, they removed some items, but some that I disputed they came back that it remains. The collector assures it's info is correct? 
I am greatly upset about this. Especially XXXX XXXX XXXX, a online loan that I paid more than I should of. They were very deceptive about their fees and what was a payday installment loan that I paid over 1500 on and still owed more than original XXXX. 
But anyway I took it out in XX/XX/XXXX they reported it as 1 month loan and updated it, so to have at least a year of no pymt 's on my report? 
I copied and sent print out of all monthly pymt 's and screen shots of email confirming loan was indeed a installment loan. Yet none of the credit reporting co. Would agree, and when I disputed there findings and asked to see companies proof they didn't respond. 
I told them also I was victim of identity thief, because alot of credit inquiries kept coming up on report. I wanted fraud put on reports so I could explain If I did apply for credit that someone was pretending to be me, XXXX and purposely putting gas on in where I lived at time my info was stolen. 
What makes me the most made is these reports are not fair or honest.experian. I signed up for protection XXXX after I did 2 big items disappeared. XXXX XXXX XXXX being one. 
Yet after 3 months when I cancelled the program. They were back on my report!! 
This is abuse of power! 
I had gotten 2 reports XXXX & Experian back up a little to around 580, but XXXX was XXXX. Yesterday I went on and it was down XXXX points? I inquired why? And a nice representative Said 'oh It just happens some times? 
I pointed out nothing was changed at all. And updated her on my filed police report reporting the identity thief and fraud.She didn't even want the report # or a copy.yet they would not put fraud on my report unless I filed one? 
It really bothers me that if I was willing to pay each company for Monitoring protection XXXX Things would vanish off my report? 
Also they do investigations Yet show no proof collector showed, yet share my information with companies? Which I know for fact one company updated dates to match my information, instead of original reported dates that collector posted which had me living in another home at the time ultility provider stated I used them? The whole process especially with identify thief is hard enough, without companies that are supposed to be trustful and impartial showing it's just the opposite. 
Honestly Now I have to wonder if they get kick back from collection companies??? 
They need monitoring. 
Along with these collectors that change bc dates to suit thier claims. 
And on a final note. My reports still aren't marked from for fraud? they have identify thief report and police report information. 
And on final note to I sent them copies of threatening lawyers emails from XXXX XXXX, threatening me with jail, fraud, to contact my probation officer if I have one etc.

Very classless, when I read the rules for collections on FCRA site.I saw this was illegal? Yet my credit report disputed monitor didn't find it so? They had copies of letters from my dispute.yet neither company said by the way XXXX, letters like this are illegal. Please look into it on identify thief site for further information. 
Yet then I wasn't paying XXXX or Experian monthly payments anymore. 
I also think it's against our civil rights if we want them to add rent, phone payments to reports to increase our scores. We have to give them our email and password for online banking, so they can verify each month instead of a yearly print out from my bank? 
I DON'T think so??? 
Invasion of privacy! 
It's sad when the credit report companies are getting as bad as the collection companies.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Unable to get your credit report or credit score
Sub-issue: Other problem getting your report or credit score
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I was opening mail concerning a credit card I applied for at XXXX. They reported that I did not qualify for the lowest interest, and stated it was based on my credit score and credit report. 

In the body of the letter I received it stated that under federal law, you have the right to obtain a copy of your credit report without charge for 60 days after you receive this notice. To obtain your free report, contact : Equifax Credit Information Services , Inc., XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, GA XXXX, XXXX http : //www.equifax.com. 

I then called the phone number to request a copy of my free report. I spoke to XXXX, and was then asked a lot of questions : my full name, my ss #, my address, my home mortgage holder and amount of my mortgage, my car loan provider and the amount I pay, my other credit card cards. 

At this time I felt I was providing information to a scammer to use against me to get my identify for fraud. 

I then asked to speak to her supervisor. After a lengthy wait I spoke to Supervisor with first name as XXXX. She said that they have to ask me these questions to ascertain whether I am the rightful holder of the credit information. I asked them how may ways do I have to confirm who I am am. Send me my report and I will report any reporting errors. I then stated that I feel this is unreasonable and unnecessary since I do not think that you asked XXXX XXXX for all this information about me BUT you sent them a report on me. 

When I asked where the supervisor where she was located, she announced the XXXX. When I told her that this smacks as your company trying to get my information to steal my identify and that I do not feel secure answering anymore questions. 

I then asked for her supervisor and she said that her supervisor would tell me the same thing. 

I then told her I would report this company to the XXXX XXXX XXXX and the Consumer Finance Agency. 

I then stated I would like her to hang up so that I can take the survey they asked me to take at the beginning of the call to tell them about my experience and to tell them how dissatisfied I was. She then wished me a good day and hung up. Then a voice next came on the call said to take the survey, press 1, which I did the connection was severed. 

I believe this company and its operation is fraudulent and as I see from many other same complaints, it should be investigated for misuse of information, not providing what they profess to provide and action taken against them to rescind their license to be credit reporting agency and the public be informed that it is not an authorized credit reporting agency. 

I also request that an investigation be made into their call collection information such as the one I experienced and whether it leads to identify theft. 

I will be following up with my congressman on this complaint.

I am writing to dispute the reporting of late payments on my credit report. I believe that these late payments are inaccurately reflecting my payment history and adversely impacting my creditworthiness. I request that they investigate this matter promptly and remove the disputed late payments from my credit report in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Creditor : XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX Date Reported : XX/XX/2023 & XX/XX/2023 I assert the following reasons for disputing the accuracy of the reported late payments : 1. Error in Reporting : I have thoroughly reviewed my payment records and have found discrepancies between the reported late payments and the actual payments made. I have consistently made timely payments to XXXX and can provide documentation to support this. 

2. Good Payment History : Prior to the alleged late payments, my payment history with XXXX has been exemplary. It is highly unlikely that I would suddenly deviate from this pattern without any valid reason or notification. 

3. Request for Investigation : I request that they conduct a thorough investigation into the accuracy and verifiability of the reported late payments. This includes verifying the dates, amounts, and any associated fees or charges. I also request that they contact XXXX to confirm the validity of the reported late payments.

Consumer complaint narrative:
My Property at XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX RI was foreclosed in XX/XX/XXXX. From XX/XX/XXXX through XXXX, Planet Home Lending has report to the credit bureaus that I am making late payments when I no longer have a loan with them. I have been trying since XXXX to get them to report correctly. I have called countless times and spoken to supervisors, who never call back. The loan number XXXX shown on credit report as XXXX does not come up in their system when I call them. my social security number does not come up in their system. I am on hold or speaking to them for hours at a time while they try to figure it out but cant seem to fix it. I am told by supervisors that they will research and call me back. Most recently XXXX and then XXXX and then on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX from the XXXX Texas office. All were suppose to be supervisors. 
Each were suppose to call me back within 3 days. None did. I called back today XX/XX/XXXX and asked for XXXX XXXX at XXXX am. I was told she was not in yet and they would have her call me. At XXXX I called again and got someone who tried to get her or another manager on the phone. He said not one supervisor or manager was available and that I should submit a dispute with the credit agency 's. I have done that many times, with no resolution. 
I have a copy of the deed being released to new people in XXXX of XXXX. I have a copy of the 1099 issued where I paid taxes on the amount the bank did not make back on the sale of the property at auction. I understand that the foreclosure will remain on my reports however, they should not continue to report my payments as late after the sale of the property. I was never given any information stating I owed them payments of any kind and no one I have spoken with indicates that I do owe anything. They all say the balance is zero. Some are nice but many are rude as though my hard times and a foreclosure makes this my fault and resolves them from the responsibility to correct this. I have spoken to countless people, hired two credit repair companies and still nothing has been corrected. This has been four years. It is reported incorrectly on my ex husbands reports as well. 

My name : XXXX XXXX My Ex Husbands name : XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Problem with personal statement of dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
This past Fall I refinanced my VA Mortgage that has been held with Quicken Loans. I reached out to Quicken in XXXX to inquire about VA IRRL options but settled on XXXX due to more competitive rates. I began receiving calls multiple times a week from Quicken in XXXX to try and get me to refinance with them as well. As those calls and voicemails continued through XXXX and XXXX I received two voicemails that my account was passed due. I contacted Quicken and was directed to the refinance team, who again was trying to sell me on a Quicken refinance and told me my loan was in good standing. I continued my refinance with XXXX XXXX and was scheduled to close in XXXX, but was delayed three times all the way to XX/XX/2020, due to XXXX XXXX being behind on closings. I continued to pay my current Quicken mortgage in the process to ensure no payments were missed in the transition. 

I was notified again by voicemail in early XXXX that I had a past due Quicken bill, which surprised me as I had seen my check to Quicken for the month clear. I called them back on XX/XX/XXXX and was told that I had {$64.00} past due balance on my over $ XXXX monthly mortgage payment, based on a change to my escrow amount that I was previously unaware of. I sent payment that day which was received and cleared on XX/XX/XXXX. I inquired as to why my escrow payment was increased when I would be getting a check to close that account within a month. They wanted me to send them {$64.00} when they were going to turn around and send me a check for over {$2000.00} within a couple weeks since that account was in the process of being closed and no more payments would be made from it. I was told by the Quicken agent on the XXXX that this would not be reported to the credit agency. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I saw that my credit report showed a late payment to Quicken. I called and spoke with XXXX XXXX who said that the escrow was recalculated in XXXX and a notification was sent. He said he could see that notifications were sent again in XXXX but noted that he could see that they were returned. I believe those notices, just like my escrow refund check which was sent to me by Quicken in XXXX, was sent to the wrong address. 

I was in the midst of refinancing and Quicken had already sent out my payoff notification to XXXX XXXX and were actively trying to get me to refinance with them instead. The Quickens sales team and account management teams failed to share information and provided me incorrect information as a customer. They admitted to sending information about changes to my account to the wrong address. They should have halted any changes to the account once it was in progress of being sold. They reported a late payment to the credit reporting agencies, after saying they would not due so due to the confusion and are inaccurately reporting a late payment. My payment was never late, it was short by 1 %, {$32.00} on an over {$3200.00} payment and even then, the principal and interest were more than covered and my escrow balance had more than enough balance to cover all payments through the remainder of the loan. So much so, that I received over {$2000.00} back from Quicken to close that escrow account in less than a month.
Company public response: None

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the reporting of late payments on my credit report. I believe that these late payments are inaccurately reflecting my payment history and adversely impacting my creditworthiness. I request that they investigate this matter promptly and remove the disputed late payments from my credit report in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Creditor : XXXX Account XXXX : XXXX Date Reported XX/XX/XXXX I assert the following reasons for disputing the accuracy of the reported late payments : 1. Error in Reporting : I have thoroughly reviewed my payment records and have found discrepancies between the reported late payments and the actual payments made. I have consistently made timely payments to XXXX and can provide documentation to support this.

2. Good Payment History : Prior to the alleged late payments, my payment history with XXXX has been exemplary. It is highly unlikely that I would suddenly deviate from this pattern without any valid reason or notification. 

3. Request for Investigation : I request that they conduct a thorough investigation into the accuracy and verifiability of the reported late payments. This includes verifying the dates, amounts, and any associated fees or charges. I also request that they contact XXXX to confirm the validity of the reported late payments.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX response to the CFPB is a blatant lie. Here is why : In XX/XX/XXXX my insurance company, XXXX, issued a new policy which required XXXX to issue a check to pay for the homeowner 's policy. The policy was incorrect and XXXX issued a second policy in XXXX to correct the incorrect policy. XXXX sent a second check to XXXX to account for the two policies. XXXX know this is what actually caused the erroneous escrow amount. I was never notified by XXXX about the two policy payments until I called. XXXX never worked with XXXX to reconcile the right account policy and I never received a letter from XXXX about my escrow account. The back dated letter they provided you is apparently a fraudulent letter because unless they can provide that the postal office delivered a letter they are lying. Additionally, I received a refund from XXXX for the two policies in XXXX without any notice or explanation for why I got {$4100.00} for my policy. I was told my XXXX XXXX escrow department that I did not need to repay the money because the amount is reflected in my mortgage payment. XXXX and my insurance company, XXXX, failed to inform me of these mistakes and did not involve me in the resolution. My credit history should not be impacted by their incompetence and their explanation is typical of XXXX. Its a lie! All they need to do reverse the inaccurate credit report. 

Mortgage Loan # XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, Rhode Island XXXX I writing this complaint because XXXX XXXX, formerly XXXX, is either fraudulently or incorrectly reporting to reporting agencies that my mortgage payment is late when in fact the payment is not late. Furthermore, there is no outstanding or pending payment required for my account. Additionally, my escrow account is incorrect and does not reflect accruals for homeowners insurance. XXXX XXXX has changed its name but its fraudulent business practices have continued right where XXXX left off. I hope that you will contact the firm and address this on my behalf.
