Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
Since the start of this mortgage, XXXX XXXX has not processed my payments. Automatic withdrawals were made and reversed each time. I have called them every week at least twice a week being on calls lasting an hour or more each time. They have made copious notes on the account but can not tell me why this keeps happening. I clearly stated if my credit was affected I would be taking action. I was assured credit would not be affected however as of this filing, my credit rating dropped XXXX points in one reporting! Each time they have not been able to identify the issue in processing my payments. When asked the reply has been " we don't know ''. 

XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( automatic withdrawal ) XX/XX/XXXX Returned Payment Reversal - {$1500.00} ( company had account number incorrect ; said fixed it ) XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( automatic withdrawal ) XX/XX/XXXX Returned Payment Reversal - {$1500.00} ( company had account number incorrect again ; said fixed it again but not sure why reverted to incorrect number ) XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( automatic withdrawal ) XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( automatic withdrawal ) XX/XX/XXXX Returned Payment Reversal - {$1500.00} ( confirmed account numbers were correct ; don't know why payment not processing ) XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( phoned in payment ) XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( phoned in payment ) Multiple phone calls from XXXX. Was assured multiple times a request for a supervisor to call was put in but never heard from anyone. Only received automated calls saying payment needed to be made. Spoke to multiple representatives detailing issue and notes supposedly made on account. At one time I was transferred to 'someone who could help '. After providing all my personal info including social security number and other identifying information, individual on the other line told me could not find my account. After an hour with this person, was told they don't service my loan and no idea how I was transferred to them ... this after taking all my identifying information!! I called XXXX XXXX back to relate what happened and was told 'sorry - don't know how that happened '. That was it - no attempt to fix it or find out who it was I was transferred to in order to be sure information was safe. Have been sent round and round being transferred back and forth to customer service. 
This company continues to have problems processing payment. I removed automatic payment in order to make payment over the phone so account would not be affected. They provided credit reporting bureaus with information that I have not paid but have and continue to do so but they do not process. I was declined a credit card ( rating had been in the XXXX ) because rating dropped to low XXXX ( XXXX points! ) due to their incorrect reporting and inability to rectify issues on their end. 

From the time I applied for the mortgage they were incompetent. The closing took 4 months ( XXXX  ) because they kept providing the closer with wrong paperwork. It took four attempts to close the mortgage before it was done correctly. 

I have never seen such an incompetent company in all my years.

Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing for two reasons. I was not informed or included in a legal settlement with CPFB and Nationstar Mortgage, dba Mr. Cooper. I believe that I should have been included in the damages paid for Mr. Cooper 's fraudulent practices because I have been complaining for years about their fraud in my mortgage account. Secondly, I am including documentation that shows Nationstar fabricated my credit report by reporting late payments when I paid on time. The discrepancy in my payment and the mortgage amount is because of Mr. Cooper manipulating my escrow account and changing my mortgage payment frequently without adequate notice starting XX/XX/XXXX and continued unit XXXX. I have never been 30, 60, or 90 days late for any mortgage payment. Nationstar has a routine practice of changing escrow with less than 30 days notice then holding timely payments in a separate suspense account and not giving credit for the payments made on time. The amount of the differences were less than {$100.00}. Nationstar routinely made adjustments then penalized mortgagees and damaged my credit for no reason other than manipulation of my account. The statements that I am providing were created more recently and were never provided to me at the time of the alleged late payments. The statements show payments being received by Nationstar when they were reporting my payments late but in fact where deposited into a suspense account. This should have been part of the litigation settlement which I should have been a part of. I did request a forbearance which I received because I temporarily lost my job during the Great Recession. The problem I have is that Nationstar has refused to remove the negative credit report because of their malfeasance in manipulation of escrow. Regular and frequent escrow calculations are not the norm in any other mortgage servicer and XXXX did so out of fraud. I have attempted to get clarification from Nationstar but they have never provided a full accounting for why the escrow frequently changed from month to month from XX/XX/XXXX until XX/XX/XXXX. In addition, Nationstar has frequently reported payments made on time as late which has damaged my credit score for years.
Company public response: None

Consumer complaint narrative:
Account was opened XXXX of XXXX. At the time my credit was checked and I was approved for the department store card. 

In XXXX of XXXX, upon closer examination of my statement, I noticed my credit line had decreased. I had received no notification of any issue. My account is in excellent standing. I phoned the provider and they stated they had no idea why my credit line had decreased and they reinstated my original credit line. 

Yesterday, while looking at my account, I noticed, yet again that my credit line had decreased. Again, no notice, no call ; no idea why. Account had a XXXX balance and excellent standing. 

I phoned the account holder today after not getting an explanation from an email the yesterday. According to the " Account Manager '' that I spoke with - XXXX has the right to periodically check my credit score from all three reporting agencies ( XXXX ; XXXX  and Experian ) and apparently are also getting credit updates on a regular basis from all three credit reporting bureaus when ever something changes on my credit report!! I never gave any permission for any company to constantly monitor my credit..and I know this is not legal. She stated that they had sent a letter on the XXXX of XXXX. I have received nothing. She also stated they mailed letters back in XXXX ( however when I checked in XXXX the Customer Service Rep I spoke with at the time told me she didn't see any letters going out ) when I brought up this had happened before, and I had never received any letter. I asked that the letter be e-mailed to me along with any documents that they state " allow '' them to monitor and get updates on my credit. She stated that she can not e-mail them and that she needs to mail them. She would not give me any reason why this has occured. 

I never gave XXXX ( XXXX XXXX  ) permission to " monitor '' my credit reports from the three major credit reporting agencies. 

I have paid off the card in question and have closed the account. I have asked that my banking information be deleted from their system and I have also requested confirmation, which I have not received. 

This is a muli-issue complaint.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
I was contacted earlier this year by a person claiming to represent Hyundai stating that I had a past due balance on my account. At that time, I was unaware of any balance due, and had already turned in this leased vehicle to the dealership months earlier, in favor of a renewed lease on a newer vehicle. While speaking to the agent on the phone, I logged into my account at hmfusa.com, and saw that I have a {$0.00} balance. My most recent statement for this account was dated XX/XX/2019 and showed Total Amount Due {$0.00}. 
Considering I had an unknown person calling me unsolicited and asking for money, while giving me conflicting information from what my online statement showed me, obviously this raised red flags. The agent was unable to tell me why my online account showed no balance due, or what the amount owed was for. The agent advised they would mail me an invoice showing me the balance due, which I agreed to review and pay if it was in fact legitimate. 
This invoice never arrived. I have still yet to receive any piece of paper showing what the balance owed is for. 
Moving forward, I have been in the process of refinancing my home. Earlier this month, my mortgage broker advised me that they noticed a sharp drop in my credit score from one day to the next. I immediately reviewed my credit report to find that Hyundai reported my account as seriously delinquent, for a vehicle I had turned in more than six months ago, and for an account to which I have no statement showing I owe any money. To add to this, my account was enrolled in autopay, which served to pay any balance for the duration of my lease. Any money owed should have just been debited from my account, but that is not what happened. 
I have since attempted to resolve this matter with Hyundai Motor Finance over the phone over multiple occasions. I was transferred, hung up on, and lied to. I was told I would receive a call back from a manager within 72 hours, only to find out a week later that no managers make outbound calls, and that there was no record of that request on my account. 
I have since paid the balance due, despite still not seeing any invoice to indicate what it was for, as my concern for the $ XXXX dollars that I was told I owed is far less than the impact this has taken on my credit report. I have worked very diligently throughout my life to maintain a flawless credit score, however this incident has taken me from over 800, to in the 600s at the time of this writing. I am in the process of trying to refinance my home, and this incident is severely impacting my ability to do so, and in turn costing me FAR more money than the {$300.00} Hyundai requested ( and in turn received ) from me.

I have now sent a letter in writing to Hyundai, as I was told this is the only method I am able to communicate with their disputes department. I initiated a dispute with XXXX when this first appeared ealier this month, however just today this has now appeared on my XXXX   report as well, despite having already been paid! 

I have attached the most recent statement I have for this account.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX of 2017 I turned in a lease early because I had a baby and was unable to use the XXXX seater. When I received the bill and it was twice what it should have been, I asked for documentation and clarification that never came. Dealing with a newborn as a single mom, I let it go. 
Now over 5 years later, I have now disputed this debt nearly XXXX times over XXXX years. I have asked for proof and documentation over and over again, but all XXXX XXXX will send me is a negotiation for settlement. They clearly have my correct address and have refused, nearly XXXX times, to provide any sort of documentation. Yet will continue to falsely report and try to negotiate a settlement. 
The amount needs to be proven- its over double what it should be. The dates are almost all incorrect, including the last payment, the payments that were made, the open date and the close date. The payment history is also inaccurate. 
When they can provide how they got to the number they claim I owe, and can correctly report that information, I will stop asking them to do the right thing.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XXXX I received a text message from phone number XXXX that my SOFI loan was in process, but that additional information was required to secure the loan. I replied STOP to opt out of any future correspondence. Aprox. XXXX minutes later I received another text notifying me that the loan had funded. On XX/XX/22 I received multiple calls from XXXX phone number XXXX requesting information to complete another loan application. This prompted me to check my credit report. Upon which time I noticed that SOFI had pulled my credit on XX/XX/22. I called SOFI and learned that a personal loan in the amount of {$12000.00} had been dispersed to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX. SOFI had all of my personal information on file ( XXXX, XXXX, Home Address, Phone, etc. ) I notified SOFI that this was a case of identity fraud and as of XX/XX/22 my case was being reviewed by their Fraud Dept. I called XXXX XXXX XXXX Bank and spoke to XXXX XXXX ( phone XXXX ) who works in their Fraud Dept. He confirmed that the funds had been received at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and that bank account XXXX was under the name XXXX XXXX. SOFI keeps forwarding me to their Fraud Investigative Team phone number ( XXXX ) that goes straight to voice mail. I can not get a valid case number or confirmation number and they will not give me a phone number or email address to call them directly. The funds have already been dispersed and I want this transaction wiped from my credit and all of my personal information removed from XXXX XXXX.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Problem with personal statement of dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
This past Fall I refinanced my VA Mortgage that has been held with XXXX Loans. I reached out to XXXX in XXXX to inquire about VA IRRL options but settled on XXXX due to more competitive rates. I began receiving calls multiple times a week from XXXX in XXXX to try and get me to refinance with them as well. As those calls and voicemails continued through XXXX and XXXX I received two voicemails that my account was passed due. I contacted XXXX and was directed to the refinance team, who again was trying to sell me on a XXXX refinance and told me my loan was in good standing. I continued my refinance with XXXX XXXX and was scheduled to close in XXXX, but was delayed three times all the way to XX/XX/2020, due to XXXX XXXX being behind on closings. I continued to pay my current XXXX XXXX in the process to ensure no payments were missed in the transition. 

I was notified again by voicemail in early XXXX that I had a past due XXXX bill, which surprised me as I had seen my check to XXXX  for the month clear. I called them back on XX/XX/XXXX and was told that I had {$64.00} past due balance on my over $ XXXX  monthly mortgage payment, based on a change to my escrow amount that I was previously unaware of. I sent payment that day which was received and cleared on XX/XX/XXXX. I inquired as to why my escrow payment was increased when I would be getting a check to close that account within a month. They wanted me to send them {$64.00} when they were going to turn around and send me a check for over {$2000.00} within a couple weeks since that account was in the process of being closed and no more payments would be made from it. I was told by the XXXX agent on the XXXX that this would not be reported to the credit agency. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I saw that my credit report showed a late payment to XXXX. I called and spoke with XXXX XXXX who said that the escrow was recalculated in XXXX and a notification was sent. He said he could see that notifications were sent again in XXXX but noted that he could see that they were returned. I believe those notices, just like my escrow refund check which was sent to me by XXXX in XXXX, was sent to the wrong address. 

I was in the midst of refinancing and XXXX had already sent out my payoff notification to XXXX XXXX and were actively trying to get me to refinance with them instead. The XXXX sales team and account management teams failed to share information and provided me incorrect information as a customer. They admitted to sending information about changes to my account to the wrong address. They should have halted any changes to the account once it was in progress of being sold. They reported a late payment to the credit reporting agencies, after saying they would not due so due to the confusion and are inaccurately reporting a late payment. My payment was never late, it was short by 1 %, {$32.00} on an over {$3200.00} payment and even then, the principal and interest were more than covered and my escrow balance had more than enough balance to cover all payments through the remainder of the loan. So much so, that I received over {$2000.00} back from XXXX to close that escrow account in less than a month.

Consumer complaint narrative:
National Recovery Agency XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX To whom it may concern ; I have tried numerous times to get this inaccurate account deleted off my consumer report and I have exercised all possible methods. I have disputed this account with all ( 3 ) consumer reporting agencies ( XXXX, XXXX and XXXX ) and with the account holder ( National Recovery Agency ), As well as requested verification of this debt. It is my understanding that not only is it the consumer reporting agencies duty to report accurate information on consumers and furnishers should also verify the information before reporting it. 

I requested undeniable proof as well as any binding documentation with my signature and only received a copy of a ( 1 ) bill statement that did not have my name and listed an address, I have never lived at. This was sent to me by National Recovery Agency. 

I am listing all the violations under the FCRA that apply to my specific situation. 


Violations under FCRA 15 U.S. Code 1681S-2 Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies.

15 U.S.Code 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) After a dispute, the information can not be furnished if the information is in fact inaccurate.

15 U.S. Code 1681S-2 ( 1 ) ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( c ) ( 2 ) - In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates Here are the violations- I am not the owner of this debt. Therefore, this account should have been properly verified for credibility of the account before reporting it on to my consumer report.

- I have 10 inaccuracies reported on my consumer report.

- Defamation of character - Loss of opportunity due to inaccuracies. Because of poor verification practices. 

Debt Collector Address : National Recovery Agency XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Debt Collector : National Recovery Agency - XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX Amount : {$750.00} This inconvenience has cost me to lose the possibility of acquiring a {$30000.00}. credit card, For which I am seeking damages of {$1000.00}. per violation under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

Consumer complaint narrative: On XXXX I XXXX XXXX the consumer, received correspondence from complaint # XXXX sent from EQUIFAX dating XXXX ; EQUIFAX conducted an investigation on my consumer report & found the accounts in my dispute to be inaccurate and unverifiable ( see attached file ). In correspondence EQUIFAX made clear I have the right to request the description of the procedure used to determine the accurateness and completeness of the information ( see attached file ). Pursuant to 15 USC 1681d ( b ) Im requesting the nature and scope of the investigation. According to FEDERAL LAW, this must be sent to me within 5 days upon receipt. Pursuant to 15 USC 1681i ( A ) ( 6 ) ( B ) Im requesting a DESCRIPTION of the procedure used to determine the inaccuracies in the incomplete information. ( Example : Contract, audit trail, failing to have my written permissible purpose ). According to FEDERAL LAW, this must be sent to me within 15 days upon receipt. Furthermore EQUIFAX knows or should know that pursuant to 15 usc 1681a ( XXXX ) The term investigative consumer report means a consumer report or portion thereof in which information on a consumers character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living is OBTAINED through PERSONAL INTERVIEWS with neighbors, friends, or associates of the consumer reported on or with others with whom he is acquainted or who may have knowledge concerning any such items of information. HOWEVER, such information SHALL NOT include specific factual information on a consumers credit record obtained directly from a creditor of the consumer or from a consumer reporting agency when such information was obtained directly from a creditor of the consumer or from the consumer. Im now requesting EQUIFAX provide me the name ( s ) of the person who theyve interviewed on my behalf to discuss my non public information to conduct the investigation and determine the investigation results. This is VITAL for me to know. Im a victim of identify theft and need to take necessary precautions. Thank you.

Sub-issue: Personal information incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
My wife and I are applying for a loan. Our lender was unable to pull the Tri-report because Equifax has both my wife and my current and previous addresses incorrectly annotated. The other two bureaus report our information correctly. 

We were advised by Equifax to provide documents, to which we did - via both fax and overnight delivery. one option NOT available to us is via faster encrypted email. We were told the issue would be resolved in 3-5 business days for the documents to be reflected on our credit file, but we would only be notified IN WRITING and via the post office that may take up to 30 days! With today 's modern technology, how can they not immediately email/text us responses that our information has been updated to prompt us to check our files? 

My wife has called Equifax daily, every business day, since XX/XX/2019. As of XX/XX/2019, we were informed by Equifax personnel that her information has not even been received by the bureau. Our queries as to whether or not the fax/mail was received only prompted scripted responses, which of course were of no value, only that we would receive written and mail responses within 30 days as to when they do correct errors that they created. 

We would like the ability to purchase our home but, when dealing with an organization whose business model is based upon data accuracy - and the absolute protection of that data - we can not move forward with a loan because a company has poor business practices. These insufficient business practices include both data accuracy and customer service related to the correction of data errors ( which, incidentally, were created by the business and not the customer ). 

We can not wait the 30 days for a letter in the mail to confirm that our addresses have been updated, nor should be wait beyond the 3-5 business days claimed by Equifax to only be told they have not received our information.

**point of clarity - I am writing on behalf of the issues pertaining to my wife. I too have errors just recently discovered, but I have only recently given Equifax my updated information. Therefore, I can not in good faith claim faulty services on my behalf ... yet.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Investigation took more than 30 days
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX. XXXX XXXX  Account XXXX Please correct this inaccurate information on my credit report. I recently pulled my credit report from your Bureau and my attorneys and I had a chance to go over my credit report and in amazement, that you have decided to report me 30 days late on this account in XX/XX/XXXX. 

I immediately disputed this information with XXXX XXXX and the results of the investigation came back " verified ''. Not only was I never late on this account, but according to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the information furnisher is required to notify me of the insertion of negative listings. Since I have disputed the lates with the creditor, and you obviously " verified '' them, I am very curious as to what kinds of " records '' you may have for this alleged account. I am very confident that you are in violation of the ( FCRA ) and ( FCBA ) sections ( 1666, 1666a. 1666b., and 1666c. ) as stated below : 1666. Correction of billing errors ( b ) Billing error ( 4 ) The creditor 's failure to reflect properly on a statement, a payment made by the obligor or a credit issued to the obligor. ( 5 ) A computation error or similar error of an accounting nature of the creditor on a statement. ( 6 ) Failure to transmit the statement required under section 1637 ( b ) of this title to the last address of the obligor which has been disclosed to the creditor, unless that address was furnished less than twenty days before the end of the billing cycle for which the statement is required. ( 7 ) Any other error described in regulations of the Bureau. 1666a. Regulation of credit reports ( a ) Reports by creditor on obligor 's failure to pay amount regarded as billing error After receiving a notice from an obligor as provided in section 1666 ( a ) of this title, a creditor or his agent may not directly or indirectly threaten to report to any person adversely on the obligor 's credit rating or credit standing because of the obligor 's failure to pay the amount indicated by the obligor under section 1666 ( a ) ( 2 ) of this title, and such amount may not be reported as delinquent to any third party until the creditor has met the requirements of section 1666 of this title and has allowed the obligor the same number of days ( not less than ten ) thereafter to make payment as is provided under the credit agreement with the obligor for the payment of undisputed amounts. ( b ) Reports by creditor on delinquent amounts in dispute ; notification of obligor of parties notified of delinquency If a creditor receives a further written notice from an obligor that an amount is still in dispute within the time allowed for payment under subsection ( a ) of this section, a creditor may not report to any third party that the amount of the obligor is delinquent because the obligor has failed to pay an amount which he has indicated under section 1666 ( a ) ( 2 ) of this title, unless the creditor also reports that the amount is in dispute and, at the same time, notifies the obligor of the name and address of each party to whom the creditor is reporting information concerning the delinquency. ( c ) Reports by creditor of subsequent resolution of delinquent amounts A creditor shall report any subsequent resolution of any delinquencies reported pursuant to subsection ( b ) to the parties to whom such delinquencies were initially reported. 1666b. Timing of payments ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. Because I take my credit very seriously, I contacted every name and account that was listed on the report. I was again very shocked by the multiple names, account numbers and figures. Included with this letter, is every letter written to those who have hampered my ability to obtain credit. I believe that any judge that looks over the report would agree that it is a violation of both the FCRA, CCPA and FACTA. The following accounts were listed on your report and I have demanded from them a full accounting and five years worth of records to see if their accounts were in violation of the FAIR CREDIT BILLING ACT ( FCBA ). We also demanded signed contracts, agreements or any legal paperwork that would tie us to the following accounts. Under the FCRA, you are required to conduct an investigation on this account if I request it. I DEMAND to see all 100 % verifiable proof that I was indeed Verifiably late on these accounts and the creditor fulfilled its obligations under ( FCBA 1666 ( a ) ( 2 ) ), As I was never notified of a billing delinquency on my accounts, which the creditor must do under section ( FCBA1666 ( b ) ( 6 ). I DEMAND to see proof that I was mailed my statement to the correct address notifying me of both payment due date and delinquency of payment on the account. If you can not provide 100 % Verifiable proof and proper documentation that the CREDITOR fulfilled its obligations under the ( FCBA ) and ( FCRA ), I therefore demand these late payments be removed from my account or I will be forced to be in contact with the Attorney General of my State and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. I therefore am submitting my written request to you to conduct an investigation. Per the FCRA, you have 30 days to conduct this investigation and respond to my request. If you do not respond within this time period, per the FCRA, you must remove this negative information. Thank you for your time, XXXX XXXX SS # : XXXX Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX Iowa XXXX, Iowa XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have initiated an investigation into a fraudulent student loan taken out under my name and have given Sallie Mae/XXXX enough information as well as new information to come to the obvious conclusion that this loan was taken out without my knowledge or consent ; that the body of the loan belonged to my late father XXXX XXXX. I did defer the loan more than once and contacted an attorney to devise a course of action. A letter was sent by XXXX XXXX XXXX who is a Elder Law/Estate Attorney in RI and has worked on my late father 's estate and under the advice of the Executor XXXX XXXX XXXX that this loan was taken out without my knowledge. In good faith, I did pay some of the loan because I was advised by said attorney to do so. XXXX XXXX ONLY wrote XXXX letter and made XXXX phone call to the XXXX XXXX XXXX office, in which they told him that because the name matches the borrower, then the loan belonged to me. XXXX XXXX has been released. My mother XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and I called the Sallie Mae office. The representatives stated that they could no longer speak to me because I had representation and gave me a phone number for said attorney that does n't exist. ( XXXX ) I filed a complaint with the FTC, the Department of Education and the XXXX Police because my Identity was stolen by my father and documents were falsified to obtain money to pay for my education. Furthermore, I have also been referenced as a mortgage holder by the Law Firm XXXX XXXX XXXX now know as XXXX XXXX XXXX being addressed to The Spouse of XXXX XXXX ''. This letter was in reference to the foreclosure of the property XXXX my former home ) XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX RI, which I have no legal link. However, I was referenced on the Sallie Mae loan as being married under my information and that any additional income was from my spouse. I am not married and never have been married. The additional income is in reference to my late fathers wife XXXX XXXX XXXX and again, she is also the Executor of his estate. There is no other link to my being referenced as " married '' but in the body of the Sallie Mae/Navient loan. 

Pay stubs have been submitted showing and will prove that I never worked at XXXX XXXX in XXXX, and never made {$100000.00}. In addition I will enclosed proof that my late father worked for XXXX XXXX and never worked for a company listed as XXXX XXXX. My father referenced myself as being married and not he. Also enclosed was a letter from XXXX XXXX XXXX my XXXX XXXX which states that she also never knew about this loan and was listed in the loan as a reference. 

I was informed from a Sallie MaeXXXX XXXX representative, XXXX XXXX that the burden of proof that I didnt know was on me. However, considering that this document was obviously falsified ( which is a crime ) and that Sallie MaeXXXX approved a loan that was obviously false leads me to believe that the burden falls on Sallie MaeXXXX to prove that I did know about where the funds for my education came from. That Sallie Mae/XXXX approved on their own an obvious illegal document. My late father XXXX XXXX took care of the finances and so did his wife XXXX XXXX XXXX because she co-signed a loan from XXXX XXXX. I was told before my father passed that I was responsible for ONLY the payment on the last semester of my time at XXXX XXXX and XXXX other loan which XXXX XXXX co signed and I have done so. 

Based on my investigation, I have advised Sallie MaeXXXX that this loan was applied for by my late father, XXXX XXXX XXXX and because of Sallie MaeXXXX XXXX XXXX rules he put me down as the borrower, there was no other option. This loan was obviously his. At this point in time, Sallie MaeXXXX has failed to filed a claim against my late father 's estate ( which is still open ), they also insisted after the XXXX day time frame ( when we called again ) that a letter was sent to the XXXX XXXX of XXXX XXXX of RI regarding the response to our opposition. In the body of the original document sent, we stated that the attorney was released. I have yet to get a confirmation that that was the case because the attorney refuses to acknowledge that he received the letter. 

My XXXX XXXX has been adversely effected after I spoke to the Sallie Mae/XXXX representatives and I was told that a freeze was to occur until the investigation was concluded. They keep emailing me stating that I 'm missing payments. All three credit bureau have been notified of the situation ( and will be notified again XXXX. Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I spoke with XXXX XXXX at Rhode Island Housing to inquire about the status of our mortgage forbearance due to covid related wage losses. XXXX advised that we were still within our 12 months of forbearance and that our payments were not required for XXXX, XXXX, or XXXX. She sent me an email that day detailing some programs that may become available should we still need assistance after XXXX, and we said that we would speak again in early XXXX to discuss further. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received notifications from the 3 credit reporting agencies that I had a 30-day late payment for my mortgage through RI Housing XXXX I immediately called XXXX and asked if this was an error and offered to provide the XXXX payment instead of continuing with the forbearance as I had no negative information on my credit up until this point. XXXX advised this was not necessary and that the credit reporting would be corrected but that they were not showing any inaccuracies on their end. 

I followed up again on XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX with " proof '' of this reporting coming from all of the credit bureaus including screen shots. I had started to receive certified letters from RIH stating that I was at risk of foreclosure, but then upon speaking with supervisor, XXXX XXXX, and Manager Loan Servicing Risk Representative, XXXX XXXX, I was assured that either my account was reported correctly ( in good standing ) or that I would need to wait several weeks for this to appear on my reporting but not to worry as I was in no way at risk of foreclosure. 

I again followed up with XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX to check in and advise that my credit had continued to plummet as I now show as 60 days late. Several of my credit cards had seen this inaccurate information and began to lower my credit allowances which again continued to drop my scores. XXXX responded with " We have corrected the late payment reporting for XX/XX/XXXX as current. Typically, the credit bureaus take 30-60 days ( sometimes sooner ) to update corrections submitted. '' My credit continued to crumble throughout the weeks and thus I followed up with XXXX again on XX/XX/XXXX to ask if there was anything else at all that could be done in the meantime. I advised that I had disputed these inaccuracies 3x directly through the credit bureaus and that they were coming back as " declined, information verified as correct. '' XXXX stated that a third-party vendor handled any disputes but that she would look into this. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I engaged XXXX XXXX for assistance with this matter. Within hours I began receiving alerts that the late payments had been removed and my score started to recover, ( although this will have no impact on the creditors that have lowered limits causing my usage to skyrocket ). 

On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX received a call from a representative at RIH who advised that our account needed an additional {$500.00} to be brought current. I inquired how this was possible given that we made an " extra '' payment in XXXX of {$1100.00} ( this was not required ), and our XXXX payment was made in full and delivered on XX/XX/XXXX. I began to explain all of the trouble we had with this in the past and offered to make the payment if necessary to avoid any additional credit related issues, but the representative refused and said they would need to look into this and " call me right back. '' I did not receive a call back and on XX/XX/XXXX I received notification from multiple credit bureaus that my account is now 60-90 days delinquent. This is all but impossible given that I have only truly " missed '' XXXX and XXXX when we were in a protected forbearance. I called and left XXXX XXXX another voicemail and I also sent a detailed email. At this point I will be seeking legal action as my credit score and reports have been extremely damaged by unfair and inaccurate reporting.
Company public response: None
Company: Rhode Island Housing and Mortgage Finance Corporation

Consumer complaint narrative: Around XX/XX/XXXX I tried to get my free credit report online from Equifax via the Annual Credit Report website. I answered all questions and then was presented with a webpage telling me I could not access my report online. I thought perhaps that I had requested it less than a year from the previous request. I subsequently requested and received my report by mail. The same problem was repeated this year around XX/XX/XXXX. After following the directions, I was again presented with the webpage saying I could not access the report online. I tried again several times since then including today ( XX/XX/XXXX ) with the same results. Sometimes I would be asked security questions and sometimes there would be no questions before telling me I could not access the report online. I made several phone calls to Equifax customer service including a supervisor. I explained the situation telling them I wanted online access. I asked them for help to do that. Each time I was told that Equifax was unable to help me since the website is on a " government computer ''. The Supervisor told me there may be a problem with my file and that I should call the dispute department. I called the dispute department today and was also told that the website was on a " government computer '' which meant they could not help. No one ever made any attempt to help me figure out the solution to my problem. Everyone was adamant that Equifax could not help me. The dispute department suggested that I do a web search to find out what agency in the government could fix my problem. I was able to find the CFPB so I could file this complaint against Equifax. I would like to receive my credit report online but have no idea what I am doing wrong or if there is some other issue keeping me from having access. I should note that I made every attempt to ensure my answers to the security questions were correct. I never was told that any answer was incorrect.

I was told my Nationstar 's escrow department that I did not need to repay the money because the amount is reflected in my mortgage payment. Nationstar and my insurance company, XXXX, failed to inform me of these mistakes and did not involve me in the resolution. My credit history should not be impacted by their incompetence and their explanation is typical of Nationstar. Its a lie! All they need to do reverse the inaccurate credit report. 

Mortgage Loan # XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, Rhode Island XXXX I writing this complaint because Mr. Cooper, formerly Nationstar, is either fraudulently or incorrectly reporting to reporting agencies that my mortgage payment is late when in fact the payment is not late. Furthermore, there is no outstanding or pending payment required for my account. Additionally, my escrow account is incorrect and does not reflect accruals for homeowners insurance. Mr. Cooper has changed its name but its fraudulent business practices have continued right where Nationstar left off. I hope that you will contact the firm and address this on my behalf.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is against our mortgage lender, XXXX XXXX XXXX for refusing to report payments accurately to credit bureaus. We filed Chapter XXXX Personal Bankruptcy in XX/XX/XXXX. We were 2-3 monthly payments behind on our mortgage ( established XX/XX/XXXX ), which our lawyer said could be included in the bankruptcy, so we could start with clean slate on our mortage the following month. We began immediately getting calls and mail about foreclosure due to delinquency from XXXX XXXX We worked that year to pay in full the additional three payments that were behind ( and majority of late payments ), while also paying our regular monthly amounts ( {$1100.00} ). We have additional loan of {$34.00} per month with XXXX XXXX for initial down payment amount that we have paid as well. Since that time, we have kept current with our mortgage payments ( 6.5 total years of making payments ).

We requested our three credit reports last year after being initially denied a used car loan. We discovered that on two of the major bureau reports ( Equifax and XXXX  ), our mortgage is listed as discharged under the XXXX Bankruptcy and closed with no further payments made. The third one does list payments being made. 
I initiated an investigation with both bureaus to check with XXXX XXXX XXXX to verify the account status is still open, current and payments have been made since XXXX XXXX bankruptcy filing. Both bureaus reported back that XXXX XXXX  did not verify payments and stated that the credit reports are accurate as they stand. 
I then called XXXX XXXX and talked to a gentleman who stated that since our attorney did not file a mortgage affirmation document, they do not have to report payments, as it is considered a bankruptcy. I asked him then if that meant that we did not have to make payments all these years as we have done. He told me that of course we had to make payments, or they would foreclose on us. I later wrote to XXXX XXXX to ask what we needed to do to reaffirm our mortgage, if there was a form that we needed to provide. I was told to talk to a lawyer. 
After doing research and seeking legal advice, I found that a loan affirmation isn't possible so many years after bankruptcy, and that it is not recommended. I also found that it is against the Federal Fair  Credit Reporting Act for a business or lender to withhold information or not accurately report if you are making payments. We have made every single required payment on our mortgage now for almost seven ( 7 ) years. While our personal bankruptcy did negatively impact our credit score and report, we feel that the current status of showing that our entire mortgage debt was discharged and now closed with no further payments has a huge impact on our credit rating. A mortgage is usually the highest monthly payments people make in their lifetime, and we would like credit for making these payments and keeping current with our mortgage. We feel that by refusing to accurately report our payments, XXXX XXXX XXXX is not adhering to fair credit reporting practices. We have tried to rectify this situation on our own by contacting the credit reporting bureaus, XXXX XXXX XXXX several times, and by seeking legal advice. We are asking for assistance in having XXXX XXXX  accurately report our payments.
Company public response: None

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Account status incorrect
Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is against our mortgage lender, Rhode Island Housing for refusing to report payments accurately to credit bureaus. We filed Chapter XXXX Personal Bankruptcy in XX/XX/XXXX. We were 2-3 monthly payments behind on our mortgage ( established XX/XX/XXXX ), which our lawyer said could be included in the bankruptcy, so we could start with clean slate on our mortage the following month. We began immediately getting calls and mail about foreclosure due to delinquency from RI Housing. We worked that year to pay in full the additional three payments that were behind ( and majority of late payments ), while also paying our regular monthly amounts ( {$1100.00} ). We have additional loan of {$34.00} per month with RI Housing for initial down payment amount that we have paid as well. Since that time, we have kept current with our mortgage payments ( 6.5 total years of making payments ). 
We requested our three credit reports last year after being initially denied a used car loan. We discovered that on two of the major bureau reports ( XXXX and XXXX ), our mortgage is listed as discharged under the XXXX Bankruptcy and closed with no further payments made. The third one does list payments being made. 
I initiated an investigation with both bureaus to check with Rhode Island Housing to verify the account status is still open, current and payments have been made since XXXX XXXX bankruptcy filing. Both bureaus reported back that RI Housing did not verify payments and stated that the credit reports are accurate as they stand. 
I then called RI Housing and talked to a gentleman who stated that since our attorney did not file a mortgage affirmation document, they do not have to report payments, as it is considered a bankruptcy. I asked him then if that meant that we did not have to make payments all these years as we have done. He told me that of course we had to make payments, or they would foreclose on us. I later wrote to RI Housing to ask what we needed to do to reaffirm our mortgage, if there was a form that we needed to provide. I was told to talk to a lawyer. 
After doing research and seeking legal advice, I found that a loan affirmation isn't possible so many years after bankruptcy, and that it is not recommended. I also found that it is against the Federal Fair Credit Reporting Act for a business or lender to withhold information or not accurately report if you are making payments. We have made every single required payment on our mortgage now for almost seven ( 7 ) years. While our personal bankruptcy did negatively impact our credit score and report, we feel that the current status of showing that our entire mortgage debt was discharged and now closed with no further payments has a huge impact on our credit rating. A mortgage is usually the highest monthly payments people make in their lifetime, and we would like credit for making these payments and keeping current with our mortgage. We feel that by refusing to accurately report our payments, Rhode Island Mortgage is not adhering to fair credit reporting practices. We have tried to rectify this situation on our own by contacting the credit reporting bureaus, Rhode Island Housing several times, and by seeking legal advice. We are asking for assistance in having RI Housing accurately report our payments.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
Company: Rhode Island Housing and Mortgage Finance Corporation

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/XXXX I went to the bank to begin the process of applying for a home loan. I got preapproved and put an offer on a house. Once the offer was accepted, I went back to the bank to continue the process and submit my application. The bank was able to pull my credit report for XXXX and XXXX but for some reason could not pull it for Equifax. They tried for multiple days before asking me to call Equifax and find out what why it could not be pulled. I spoke to three different customer service representatives, the first checked to make sure there was not a freeze on my account- there was not. She said the bank should be able to pull my report so I told the bank and they tried again, and again they could not pull the report. I called back and was told yet again they could not figure out why the bank could not pull my report. The customer service representative told me to create an account through myequifax.com in order to view my report myself. I tried to create an account and it brought up an error message and told me to call equifax, which I did. They could not tell me why I could not create an account. On XX/XX/XXXX, I figured it out on my own that if I created an account using my maiden name and not my married name that it allowed me to log on and view my report. I called Equifax and explained this. They FINALLY realized that they still had my in their system under my maiden name ( got married 2 1/2 years ago ) and my old address ( from 6 years ago ). They told me to fax over information to them in order for them to update it, and that i would take 5-7 business days. On XX/XX/XXXX I faxed over the information. I informed the bank that this was why it could not be pulled. The mortgage lender said she tried to pull my credit report using just my maiden name to see if that would work and it still would not pull a report. I went on XXXX and tried to order a credit report through equifax and was given a message that I could not order online through them, so I called. I am still waiting for that report to be mailed to me. We're also now on day 9 and the customer service representative I spoke to this morning said they had no received my fax with the information ... well he said, they either did not receive it OR they received it and have not updated it yet. He told me to fax it again. This has been going on for over a month now and the bank is waiting to approve my loan all because of this one credit report that I somehow can not receive. Please help.
Company public response: None

Consumer complaint narrative:
I have initiated an investigation into a fraudulent student loan taken out under my name and have given XXXX XXXX enough information as well as new information to come to the obvious conclusion that this loan was taken out without my knowledge or consent ; that the body of the loan belonged to my late father XXXX XXXX. I did defer the loan more than once and contacted an attorney to devise a course of action. A letter was sent by XXXX XXXX ( who is a Elder Law/Estate Attorney in RI and has worked on my XXXX  father 's estate and under the advice of the Executor XXXX XXXX ) that this loan was taken out without my knowledge. In good faith, I did pay some of the loan because I was advised by said attorney to do so. XXXX XXXX ONLY wrote one letter and made one phone call to the XXXX XXXX Loan office, in which they told him that because the name matches the borrower, then the loan belonged to me. XXXX XXXX has been released. My mother ( XXXX XXXX ) and I called the XXXX XXXX office. The representatives stated that they could no longer speak to me because I had representation and gave me a phone number for said attorney that does n't exist. ( XXXX ) I filed a complaint with the FTC, the Department of Education and the State Police because my Identity was stolen by my father and documents were falsified to obtain money to pay for my education. Furthermore, I have also been referenced as a mortgage holder by the Law Firm XXXX XXXX ( now know as XXXX XXXX ) being addressed to The Spouse of XXXX XXXX ''. This letter was in reference to the foreclosure of the property ( my former home ) XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX RI, which I have no legal link. However, I was referenced on the XXXX XXXX loan as being married under my information and that any additional income was from my spouse. I am not married and never have been married. The additional income is in reference to my XXXX  fathers wife XXXX XXXX XXXX and again, she is also the Executor of his estate. There is no other link to my being referenced as " married '' but in the body of the XXXX XXXX loan. 

Pay stubs have been submitted showing and will prove that I never worked at XXXX XXXX in XXXX, and never made {$100000.00}. In addition I will enclosed proof that my late father worked for XXXX XXXX and never worked for a company listed as XXXX XXXX. My father referenced myself as being married and not he. Also enclosed was a letter from XXXX XXXX ( my Aunt ) which states that she also never knew about this loan and was listed in the loan as a reference. 

I was informed from a XXXX XXXX XXXX representative, XXXX , that the burden of proof that I didnt know was on me. However, considering that this document was obviously falsified ( which is a crime ) and that XXXX XXXX approved a loan that was obviously false leads me to believe that the burden falls on XXXX XXXX to prove that I did know about where the funds for my education came from. That XXXX XXXX approved on their own an obvious illegal document. My late father XXXX XXXX took care of the finances and so did his wife XXXX XXXX XXXX because she co-signed a loan from XXXX XXXX. I was told before my father XXXX  that I was responsible for ONLY the payment on the last semester of my time at XXXX College and one other loan which XXXX XXXX co signed and I have done so. 

Based on my investigation, I have advised XXXX XXXX that this loan was applied for by my late father, XXXX XXXX XXXX and because of XXXX XXXX XXXX 's rules he put me down as the borrower, there was no other option. This loan was obviously his. At this point in time, XXXX XXXX has failed to filed a claim against my late father 's estate ( which is still open ), they also insisted after the thirty day time frame ( when we called again ) that a letter was sent to the XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX of RI regarding the response to our opposition. In the body of the original document sent, we stated that the attorney was released. I have yet to get a confirmation that that was the case because the attorney refuses to acknowledge that he received the letter. 

My credit score has been adversely effected after I spoke to the XXXX XXXX representatives and I was told that a freeze was to occur until the investigation was concluded. They keep emailing me stating that I 'm missing payments. All three credit bureau have been notified of the situation ( and will be notified again ). XXXX XXXX received an email from one or more reporting agencies that the stated loan is not mine. As I have stated before, I have sent XXXX XXXX additional documents to prove this to be the case. 

In conclusion, I need XXXX XXXX to admit negligence, that they approved a fraudulent and illegal document willingly, that they reverse any disparing marks on my credit reports, that they acknowledge that although the money went to my education, the true owner was my late father ( he insisted that I be kept out of the details of my education 's funding ) and because he XXXX, it should be forgiven. I am also insisting that monies sent to XXXX XXXX be refunded and that they file for damages against the estate of XXXX XXXX through the Executor. I can not be held accountable for the actions of my XXXX father.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Equifax mishandled my personal information including Name, Social Security Number, Address, Birthdate, etc. resulting in a data breach in XXXX/XXXX 2017. Equifax confirmed I was affected by this breach per their " Potential Impact '' site www.equifaxsecurity2017. 

Equifax put myself and millions of others at risk of identity theft/fraud due to negligent security protocols in handling consumer information. Equifax is further attempting to capitalize on its gross negligence by encouraging injured parties to register for " trial periods '' of their ID protection services, defrauding these injured parties with hidden subscription fees that are imposed after the trial period expires, as well as with terms of service that waive customers ' rights to sue the company for criminal negligence/fraudulent behavior. 

I demand that Equifax rectify its gross negligence through the following actions : 1 ) Permanently waive all fees for placing and removing security freezes on credit reports.
2 ) Issue full refunds to all individuals who purchased security freezes from credit reporting firms following this data breach.
3 ) Permanently waive all fees for placing or removing fraud alerts on credit reports.
4 ) Issue refunds to all individuals who purchased fraud alerts from credit reporting firms following this data breach.
5 ) Enable individuals to place permanent fraud alerts on credit histories at no charge, instead of limiting fraud alerts to 7-year periods.
6 ) Issue unique Personal Identification Numbers ( PINs ) to individuals who request security freezes on credit reports, instead issuing PINS that are actually easily replicated date stamps in the format of MMDDYYXXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative: My husband and I are in the process of buying a house and went under contract, a month later our credit report was re-pulled to be sure nothing came up that would need to be resolved. We were not under the impression anything would. We found that we were marked late with our car loan through JP Morgan Chase for a month which we were not late. For two months prior we were late due to me being in and out of the hospital, my husband missing work, and unbeknownst to me, you are able to change date of payment with no penalty as long as it falls in the month. I was unaware of this and therefore those months were late. I paid those months ( XXXX and XXXX ) to date in the first week of XXXX on XXXX XXXX, 2017, amount {$490.00}, once this was paid to date, I then paid for the month of XXXX on XXXX XXXX, 2017, amount {$240.00}. My payment date is the XXXX of every month so I was sure to pay within the 30 day window. Paying on the XXXX was within that 30 day window. I called and spoke to SEVERAL different people all who told me they could not help me unless they were in the wrong. An investigation was opened with customer support that I called about daily. I was sent to the highest supervisor I could go to who was apologetic for the situation, but told me he could n't give me a letter stating they would remove this from my report, the best he could do was refund all late fees. He told me I had to go through the credit bureaus which I do n't have time to wait on considering the situation. He sent me to the executive office. They opened an investigation after speaking to two different people in this department, one of whom argued with me until she admitted they were at fault and noted my account. After proving my point that for the month of XXXX I was not late and stating several different times to several different people how time sensitive this is and I need a letter stating this will be removed from my credit to move forward with buying the house, I was unsuccessful in dealing with Chase and told I had to dispute this with the credit bureaus because they are n't authorized to send such letters and they could n't guarantee it would be removed through a dispute. I am at risk to lose my deposit, the house, and I ha e two little ones, another on the way, and this has tossed our world upside down. Chase has acted unreasonably in this situation. With me not being at fault for the month of XXXX, this should be removed from my credit.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX Bank has taken adverse action against me, with forethought and malice, by furnishing inaccurate and knowingly false late payments to my consumer report without my lawful authority. This adverse action as defined under 12 CFR 1002.2 ( c ) ( 1 ) ( i ), which has the same definition as 15 U.S. Code 1691 ( d ) ( 6 ), has negatively affected my ability to extend credit and operate in commerce. Congress makes it clear that causing a restraint of trade or conspiring to cause a restraint of trade, pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1, is declared to be illegal to and carries both civil and criminal penalties. My right to privacy and my right to know where and how to direct the disclosure of my nonpublic information in accordance with 15 U.S. Code 6801 ( a ) of the Gramm-Leach Bliley Financial Protection Act, has been violated.

I am aware that not excluding transactions between, I, the consumer, and the creditor is a violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681a ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ). The consumer reporting agencies were not exercising their grave responsibility in respect to impartiality when furnishing this false and misleading information to my consumer report. Reasonable procedures were not taken to insure the accuracy of the information given by XXXX XXXX Bank before furnishing it. This shows that the consumer reporting agencies have shown bias towards me because I never gave my lawful authority for any consumer reporting agency or XXXX XXXX Bank to furnish any late payments to my consumer report. It is my belief that due to XXXX XXXX Bank business relationship with the consumer reporting agencies, ( such as XXXX, XXXX, Transunion ), they parrot any information given to them as a means of coercing consumers to pay extra fees for debts that they allegedly owe.

I have a copy of the 1099 issued where I paid taxes on the amount the bank did not make back on the sale of the property at auction. I understand that the foreclosure will remain on my reports however, they should not continue to report my payments as late after the sale of the property. Consumer complaint narrative: I contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX. Received information to pay off a debt for a XXXX XXXX XXXX through XXXX XXXX. I paid the debt off in the amount of {$3200.00} on XXXX XXXX, XXXX. When I paid off the loan through XXXX XXXX they explained that it could take up to 90 days before I would see the reflection on my credit report. After waiting 6 months, I contacted XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ) to report to them that my credit was still negatively being affected. They suggested I contact XXXX XXXX XXXX to resolve this matter as once I paid off the debt they were no longer an active party. From XXXX XXXX to XXXX XXXX, XXXX, I repaid XXXX  XXXX XXXX another {$460.00} debt to release a hold I had on my records. Once my record was paid in full I contacted XXXX XXXX accountant in the student loan office to confirm there was a XXXX balance on all debts owed in my name to the College. She assured me that I did, indeed, have a XXXX balance. She sent me XXXX letters stating that I have paid my debts to XXXX XXXX XXXX in full. She advised me to file a dispute with Equifax which I did in XXXX XXXX, without the letters, which they closed, and another in XXXX XXXX with the letters from XXXX XXXX XXXX as proof. I received notification from Equifax on XXXX XXXX, XXXX, stating that they contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX and that XXXX XXXX XXXX said that the debt was not paid. On XXXX XXXX, XXXX, I went to XXXX XXXX XXXX to speak with them in person about this matter. I spoke directly with XXXX XXXX who contacted XXXX XXXX who explained they never reported any of the debt to any credit bureau. Please note that Equifax is the only credit company reporting this debt in any form on my credit reports. XXXX attempted to contact Equifax. Equifax had a recording which stated that " you have reached the maximum attempts to contact Equifax '' and then disconnected the line. She also stated that she never received any documentation or phone call regarding the credit dispute from Equifax. XXXX said she 'll continue to look into it on her end and suggested I take further action as this has been negatively impacting my credit score. Equifax also advised me to follow up with XXXX XXXX XXXX providing the wrong address for the location.

On  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX , after making all my payments on time, every month, with no issue, I had saved enough to settle the rest of the account and called  XXXX . I spoke with  XXXX   XXXX , a manager, who assured me that if I paid the {$14000.00} that my account would have a {$0.00} balance and  XXXX  would update my credit reports. So I paid the {$14000.00} and was provided a reference number of  XXXX . I received the settlement offer and a {$0.00} balance letter in writing showing that my account was settled in full. I let a couple months go by and my reports are still not updated. I submitted disputes to all  XXXX  credit bureaus on  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX  and it 's still showing that my account is charged-off, with an open balance, a past due amount and payment terms after the investigations were completed. This is not right. I settled these accounts so I could improve my creditworthiness and now it 's almost as if I never made the payment. I even had Transunion re-report that the accounts were 120 days past due on  XXXX / XXXX / XXXX  when I had already settled the account 45 days earlier. Can you please help? Consumer complaint narrative:
In reference to my Previous complain file XX/XX/2022. Its been More than 30 days since i filed a complaint disputing the following accounts XXXX XXXX XXXX account number : XXXX XXXX  account number : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX account number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  account number : XXXX XXXX XXXX account number : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX account number : XXXX XXXX account number : XXXX XXXX XXXX account number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXA account XXXX XXXX XXXX account number : XXXX XXXX account number : XXXX According to Fair credit Reporting Act 1

5 U.S. Code 1681i section ( 1 ) ( A ) states that if the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumers file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the agency directly, or indirectly through a reseller, of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or reseller. further more i wasn't notified within 5 business days that my dispute was being investigated. According to Fair credit Reporting Act 15 U.S. Code 1681i section ( 2 ) ( A ) states thatThe consumer reporting agency shall promptly provide to the person who provided the information in dispute all relevant information regarding the dispute that is received by the agency from the consumer or the reseller after the period referred to in subparagraph ( A ) and before the end of the period referred to in paragraph ( 1 ) ( A ). I now Demand for the above accounts to be removed from my credit report as fast as possible

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Investigation took more than 30 days
Consumer complaint narrative:
1. XXXX XXXX  Account XXXX Please correct this inaccurate information on my credit report. I recently pulled my credit report from your Bureau and my attorneys and I had a chance to go over my credit report and in amazement, that you have decided to report me 30 days late on this account in XX/XX/XXXX. 

I immediately disputed this information with XXXX XXXX and the results of the investigation came back " verified ''. Not only was I never late on this account, but according to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the information furnisher is required to notify me of the insertion of negative listings. Since I have disputed the lates with the creditor, and you obviously " verified '' them, I am very curious as to what kinds of " records '' you may have for this alleged account. I am very confident that you are in violation of the ( FCRA ) and ( FCBA ) sections ( 1666, 1666a. 1666b., and 1666c. ) as stated below : 1666. Correction of billing errors ( b ) Billing error ( 4 ) The creditor 's failure to reflect properly on a statement, a payment made by the obligor or a credit issued to the obligor. ( 5 ) A computation error or similar error of an accounting nature of the creditor on a statement. ( 6 ) Failure to transmit the statement required under section 1637 ( b ) of this title to the last address of the obligor which has been disclosed to the creditor, unless that address was furnished less than twenty days before the end of the billing cycle for which the statement is required. ( 7 ) Any other error described in regulations of the Bureau. 1666a. Regulation of credit reports ( a ) Reports by creditor on obligor 's failure to pay amount regarded as billing error After receiving a notice from an obligor as provided in section 1666 ( a ) of this title, a creditor or his agent may not directly or indirectly threaten to report to any person adversely on the obligor 's credit rating or credit standing because of the obligor 's failure to pay the amount indicated by the obligor under section 1666 ( a ) ( 2 ) of this title, and such amount may not be reported as delinquent to any third party until the creditor has met the requirements of section 1666 of this title and has allowed the obligor the same number of days ( not less than ten ) thereafter to make payment as is provided under the credit agreement with the obligor for the payment of undisputed amounts. ( b ) Reports by creditor on delinquent amounts in dispute ; notification of obligor of parties notified of delinquency If a creditor receives a further written notice from an obligor that an amount is still in dispute within the time allowed for payment under subsection ( a ) of this section, a creditor may not report to any third party that the amount of the obligor is delinquent because the obligor has failed to pay an amount which he has indicated under section 1666 ( a ) ( 2 ) of this title, unless the creditor also reports that the amount is in dispute and, at the same time, notifies the obligor of the name and address of each party to whom the creditor is reporting information concerning the delinquency. ( c ) Reports by creditor of subsequent resolution of delinquent amounts A creditor shall report any subsequent resolution of any delinquencies reported pursuant to subsection ( b ) to the parties to whom such delinquencies were initially reported. 1666b. Timing of payments ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. Because I take my credit very seriously, I contacted every name and account that was listed on the report. I was again very shocked by the multiple names, account numbers and figures. Included with this letter, is every letter written to those who have hampered my ability to obtain credit. I believe that any judge that looks over the report would agree that it is a violation of both the FCRA, CCPA and FACTA. The following accounts were listed on your report and I have demanded from them a full accounting and five years worth of records to see if their accounts were in violation of the FAIR CREDIT BILLING ACT ( FCBA ). We also demanded signed contracts, agreements or any legal paperwork that would tie us to the following accounts. Under the FCRA, you are required to conduct an investigation on this account if I request it. I DEMAND to see all 100 % verifiable proof that I was indeed Verifiably late on these accounts and the creditor fulfilled its obligations under ( FCBA 1666 ( a ) ( 2 ) ), As I was never notified of a billing delinquency on my accounts, which the creditor must do under section ( FCBA1666 ( b ) ( 6 ). I DEMAND to see proof that I was mailed my statement to the correct address notifying me of both payment due date and delinquency of payment on the account. If you can not provide 100 % Verifiable proof and proper documentation that the CREDITOR fulfilled its obligations under the ( FCBA ) and ( FCRA ), I therefore demand these late payments be removed from my account or I will be forced to be in contact with the Attorney General of my State and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. I therefore am submitting my written request to you to conduct an investigation. Per the FCRA, you have 30 days to conduct this investigation and respond to my request. If you do not respond within this time period, per the FCRA, you must remove this negative information. Thank you for your time, XXXX XXXX SS # : XXXX Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX BCC : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau po box 4503 Iowa City, Iowa 52244
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Thank you consumer finance for your assistance in this matter and the work that you do.

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
This year, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and Wells Fargo have all lowered my credit limits on accounts that are, and have always been in good standing. 
This creates a snowball effect, as my FICO scores drop to reflect an increase of debt to available credit, even though the amount of my debt has not increased.

The strategy behind this is clear. The lenders want to prevent me from flipping balances from one card over to another, to take advantage of reduced or XXXX percent interest rates. When my promotional rates expire, they go to 30 % or more, and any effort to open a new line of credit reduces my score even more. 
This is dirty business. Ive never been late on anything. I have told these creditors that if my interest rates skyrocket, I wont pay them back at all. They dont care : My FICO scores are already ruined because of this.

Corporate greed and stupidity.

FICO scoring and lending industry abuse of this system DIRECTLY CAUSED the financial crisis of 2008. I lost XXXX homes and life savings because of this. 
See my website, XXXX. 
This business model is applied universally. The people it victimizes are rarely aware of the real reasons behind their credit problems.

FICO scoring is the SOLE PARAMETER by which an applicants credit worthiness can be evaluated or considered. Nobody reads credit reports anymore. This is a corporate screwjob, and creditors who engage in it dont deserve to be paid. Tell them to stuff it, along with their dirty business tricks. Dont sanction or tolerate legalized theft.

I am a tax paying citizen and feel like there should be some government intervention to ensure Equifax is accountable. I know this is unprecedented but I do not believe that I ever " signed up '' to allow a credit agency to warehouse my personal information and if they did so, without my explicit permission ( which may have indicated that I accepted whatever resulting risk ), then they should also have the responsibility to protect the information. Consumer complaint narrative:
Since the start of this mortgage, XXXX XXXX has not processed my payments. Automatic withdrawals were made and reversed each time. I have called them every week at least twice a week being on calls lasting an hour or more each time. They have made copious notes on the account but can not tell me why this keeps happening. I clearly stated if my credit was affected I would be taking action. I was assured credit would not be affected however as of this filing, my credit rating dropped XXXX points in one reporting! Each time they have not been able to identify the issue in processing my payments. When asked the reply has been " we don't know ''. 

XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( automatic withdrawal ) XX/XX/XXXX Returned Payment Reversal - {$1500.00} ( company had account number incorrect ; said fixed it ) XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( automatic withdrawal ) XX/XX/XXXX Returned Payment Reversal - {$1500.00} ( company had account number incorrect again ; said fixed it again but not sure why reverted to incorrect number ) XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( automatic withdrawal ) XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( automatic withdrawal ) XX/XX/XXXX Returned Payment Reversal - {$1500.00} ( confirmed account numbers were correct ; don't know why payment not processing ) XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( phoned in payment ) XX/XX/XXXX Mortgage Payment {$1500.00} ( phoned in payment ) Multiple phone calls from XXXX. Was assured multiple times a request for a supervisor to call was put in but never heard from anyone. Only received automated calls saying payment needed to be made. Spoke to multiple representatives detailing issue and notes supposedly made on account. At one time I was transferred to 'someone who could help '. After providing all my personal info including social security number and other identifying information, individual on the other line told me could not find my account. After an hour with this person, was told they don't service my loan and no idea how I was transferred to them ... this after taking all my identifying information!! I called XXXX XXXX back to relate what happened and was told 'sorry - don't know how that happened '. That was it - no attempt to fix it or find out who it was I was transferred to in order to be sure information was safe. Have been sent round and round being transferred back and forth to customer service. 
This company continues to have problems processing payment. I removed automatic payment in order to make payment over the phone so account would not be affected. They provided credit reporting bureaus with information that I have not paid but have and continue to do so but they do not process. I was declined a credit card ( rating had been in the XXXX ) because rating dropped to low XXXX ( XXXX points! ) due to their incorrect reporting and inability to rectify issues on their end. 

From the time I applied for the mortgage they were incompetent. The closing took 4 months ( XXXX ) because they kept providing the closer with wrong paperwork. It took four attempts to close the mortgage before it was done correctly. 

I have never seen such an incompetent company in all my years.
